 * Do not pre-convert SVG to JPG, let Sphinx choose the best image

 * Optimize diagram scaling for consistent font sizing and clean PDF
   layouts

Change-Id: I22285f5284f3c396ebe98392fca3dc731b01d6fa
'}, {'created': '2013-12-12 01:27:44.000000000', 'message': 'Use SVG graphics in HTML docs

 * Pre-convert SVG images to PDF with Inkscape

 * Do not pre-convert SVG to JPG, let Sphinx choose the best image

Change-Id: I22285f5284f3c396ebe98392fca3dc731b01d6fa

commit_message:
Use SVG graphics in HTML docs

 * Pre-convert SVG images to PDF with Inkscape

 * Do not pre-convert SVG to JPG, let Sphinx choose the best image
   format (SVG or PDF)

 * Optimize diagram scaling for consistent font sizing and clean PDF
   layouts

Change-Id: I22285f5284f3c396ebe98392fca3dc731b01d6fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 11:51:19.000000000', 'message': 'doc: remove note about Nova plugin framework

The architecture doc alludes to a Nova plugin framework which is now
considered obsolete.

See oslo-incubator review I5552b5625e26f4821464807743545ec6f5117f2b
(commit 4b78868) for more background.

Change-Id: Id170510bc3147af94941c993ffe6997c418d4be4
'}]
commit_message:
doc: remove note about Nova plugin framework

The architecture doc alludes to a Nova plugin framework which is now
considered obsolete.

See oslo-incubator review I5552b5625e26f4821464807743545ec6f5117f2b
(commit 4b78868) for more background.

Change-Id: Id170510bc3147af94941c993ffe6997c418d4be4

commit_message:
Updates tox.ini to use new features

tox 1.6 allows us to skip the sdist step, which is slow. This does that.
It also allows us to override the install line. In this case, it's
important as it allows us to stop getting pre-release software we
weren't asking for.

Original patch by Monty Taylor, talked about here:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-September/015495.html

Change-Id: Idcc32f7191df85eaac35f4f07256847b677b27fe

commit_message:
Enable live migrations with Ceph

* Add a new ceph user and pool for ephemeral drive storage
* Update nova configuration
* Open required libvirt ports
* Restrict VNC traffic to management network

Change-Id: Ic11e83f11081458e28655d2bf94d42e49b5feb16

[{'created': '2013-12-12 07:44:40.000000000', 'message': 'Keystone Verify - Further clarity on the use of ADMIN_PASS

A user reported an issue that the documentation was not clear as to where
the "ADMIN_PASS" paramater came from. I've clarified this further and
added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281
(cherry picked from commit 6dc666cef773fafa0ff632664a7641ab75872525)
'}]
commit_message:
Keystone Verify - Further clarity on the use of ADMIN_PASS

A user reported an issue that the documentation was not clear as to where
the "ADMIN_PASS" paramater came from. I've clarified this further and
added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281
(cherry picked from commit 6dc666cef773fafa0ff632664a7641ab75872525)

commit_message:
Deny API requests where context doesn't match path

We shouldn't overwrite the context tenant_id (which comes from the
scope of the auth_token) with that from the path, instead raise a
HTTPForbidden exception if the path-provided tenant_id doesn't match
the context.

Change-Id: Ib6fb9881103312f7492081a20178f12309f35d81
Closes-Bug: #1256983

commit_message:
Fix broken argument name in v2 volume extend routine

The new_size attribute was misspelled, causing the volume extend
operation to fail with:

    ERROR: 'Namespace' object has no attribute 'new_size'

This happens only with the v2 API, v1 works fine.

Change-Id: Icb6b5008dad229f21e7906d9b5342d41f5e760cd
Closes-Bug: #1259552

commit_message:
Reset-state and snapshot-reset-state for multiple objects

This allows a user to call reset-state or snapshot-reset-state on a
list of objects.  The behavior is modeled after a similar change to
delete multiple volumes.

$ cinder reset-state good_volume good_volume_2
<no output>

Error behavior is as follows:

One success/one failure:
$ cinder reset-state good_volume asdf
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

One failure:
$ cinder reset-state asdf
ERROR: Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.

Two failures:
$ cinder reset-state asdf qwert
Reset state for volume asdf failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'asdf' exists.
Reset state for volume qwert failed: No volume with a name or ID of 'qwert' exists.
ERROR: Unable to reset the state for any of the specified volumes.

Related-Bug: 1241941
Closes-Bug: 1256069
Change-Id: Id0a36fb7de0d69be0dac98ea04e4708775250b7a

commit_message:
Fix mysqldump backup and restore

* Move innobackupex logic out of backupagent
* Re-directing stderr for mysqldump command
* Using sudo for mysqldump restore command

Closes-Bug: 1239408

[{'created': '2013-12-07 14:23:11.000000000', 'message': 'Removing IDE specific ignores

Reasons
- .gitignore contains IDE specific ignores
- IDE specific ignores should be setup using
  global gitignore on local box.
  for eg. create a .gitignore locally and use ...

commit_message:
Removing IDE specific ignores

Reasons
- .gitignore contains IDE specific ignores
- IDE specific ignores should be setup using
  global gitignore on local box.
  for eg. create a .gitignore locally and use ...
  git config --global core.excludesfile .gitignore

Changes
- Removed .idea generated by IntelliJ.
- Removed .DS_Store generated by Mac OS.
- Removed .project generated by Eclipse.
- Removed .pydevproject generated by PyDev.
- Removed atlassian-ide-plugin.xml
  generated by Atlassian IDE.

Change-Id: I902e980834716edb8a30ca58df520fd3fc0f73aa
Closes-Bug: #1257279

commit_message:
Updates trove-guestagent.conf.sample

Reason:
- Parameter service_registry_ext has been replaced
  by datastore_registry_ext.
- trove-guestagent.conf.sample contains
  service_registry_ext, should be
  datastore_registry_ext instead.

Changes:
- Updates service_registry_ext to
  datastore_registry_ext in
  trove-guestagent.conf.sample.

Change-Id: I27feb57790011da659f1f2c5e67def08623aa490
Closes-Bug: #1260294

commit_message:
Enabling H403, H702 rules

Reasons
- Currently H403, H702 rules are ignored
- Project has files violating H403, H702 rules.

Changes
- Enables H403, H702 rules.
- Updates the code not following H403, H702 rules.

Change-Id: Ie6f289bf10ee6d6c61feeee0d9905361f236813b
Closes-Bug: #1258592

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 14:25:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes trove help command

Reason:
- trove help output misplaces the position of "<subcommand> ..."
  from bottom to top.
- This behavior is because of formatting done to
  Print positionals before optionals.

Changes:
- Sequence fixed in trove help output.

Change-Id: I8aff2eec9f915a7ec1960b67ee7ba8423624aad6
Closes-Bug: #1260332
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes trove help command

Reason:
- trove help output misplaces the position of "<subcommand> ..."
  from bottom to top.
- This behavior is because of formatting done to
  Print positionals before optionals.

Changes:
- Sequence fixed in trove help output.

Change-Id: I8aff2eec9f915a7ec1960b67ee7ba8423624aad6
Closes-Bug: #1260332

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 13:50:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the number of works for non proxies

We were running as auto so swift would spawn a lot of process consuming
process and not really in a devstack enviromenent.

Closes-Bug: 1259548
Change-Id: I6b5266186168fe99568dda5453b436c2f9cfedb3
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 15:40:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the amount of workers spawned for non proxies

We were running as auto so swift would spawn a lot of processes
consuming memory and CPU which are not really neeeded in a devstack env
(and bad for the jenkins vm).

Closes-Bug: 1259548
Change-Id: I6b5266186168fe99568dda5453b436c2f9cfedb3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the amount of workers spawned for non proxies

We were running as auto so swift would spawn a lot of processes
consuming memory and CPU which are not really neeeded in a devstack env
(and bad for the jenkins vm).

Closes-Bug: 1259548
Change-Id: I6b5266186168fe99568dda5453b436c2f9cfedb3

commit_message:
Remove erroneous logfile in scripts directory

Removes the run_tests.log file from scripts directory,
which is already there in global .gitignore,
overriden by local path .gitignore.

Change-Id: Ifb232bfb5b55b69b8593203f75d1762df9bd4a3e
Closes-Bug: #1260158

- check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-grizzly http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-grizzly/75f6cbb : FAILURE in 6m 04s (non-voting)
- check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full-grizzly http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full-grizzly/14312a2 : SUCCESS in 39m 47s (non-voting)
- check-devstack-dsvm-cells-grizzly http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-devstack-dsvm-cells-grizzly/011a032 : SUCCESS in 11m 26s (non-voting)
- check-tempest-dsvm-cells-grizzly http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-cells-grizzly/665fa5c : SUCCESS in 16m 03s (non-voting)

- check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-havana http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-havana/1a647d5 : SUCCESS in 30m 01s (non-voting)
- check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full-havana http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-postgres-full-havana/6c625bb : SUCCESS in 35m 09s (non-voting)
- check-devstack-dsvm-cells-havana http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-devstack-dsvm-cells-havana/a893f4f : SUCCESS in 11m 31s (non-voting)
- check-tempest-dsvm-cells-havana http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-cells-havana/4649629 : FAILURE in 14m 14s (non-voting)
- check-tempest-dsvm-cells-full-havana http://logs.openstack.org/37/61137/1/check/check-tempest-dsvm-cells-full-havana/c4711bf : FAILURE in 23m 57s (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-12-11 11:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I just thought people did not want the devstack default changed; the value proposed in this patch is the lowest timeout that I see never failing on the tests I've done on the gate.

But I have no strong reason for having the patch either in devstack-gate or devstack; if we deem ok changing the devstack default I'm ok with that."}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-12 02:07:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I feel very strongly that we should be testing defaults except when the test case itself is about testing something extraordinary.

-> This shouldn't be in *either* devstack or devstack-gate : it should be in Neutron."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:44:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Robert,

In real-life deployments we probably don't need to set the timeout to 10.
A real-life deployment is one whether the dhcp agent, and the l3 agent are on distinct host, and the load on vswitchd and ovsdbserver is much less than what currently happens when running single-host tempest smoke tests with parallelism and full tenant isolation. This is why I initially proposed to increase the tests just for the gate tests.

Keeping this in mind, we're actually splitting hairs here; if nobody from the neutron's core team objects to increasing the default to 10 I'll do that there.

On the other hand I don't see what would be the negative effect of increasing the default ovs timeout."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:44:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-12 19:11:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Cool - thanks. That said, I don't understand why the load would be a lot lower: tempest is only equivalent to 10-20 tenants, real world is *much* busier :)"}]

commit_message:
give a fullscreen attribute to workflow, for modal view

starting implementation of
http://ask-openstackux.rhcloud.com/question/11/modals-and-supporting-different-screen-sizes/

add a fullscreen attribute on Workflow (default to false)
use the fullscreen class in workflow template if True
add .modal.fullscreen rule in horizon.less
add documentation of the fullscreen attribute on WorkFlowView

Change-Id: Idc0e3a36e47cef1da6ef70cdfe589d74d040c361

commit_message:
Improve description of some commands

Change description of sample-list and statistics commands to not refer
to the meter as "this meter(s)".

Change-Id: Ib8301361f43f8e08ef9975a609548afffba1ba41
Closes-Bug: #1259853

commit_message:
Add the driver name to get stats log output

When the manager call tries to update the driver
stats, it checks to ensure the driver is initialized.
When the driver hasn't been initialized, it logs
a warning without the driver name.  This is confusing
for multiple backends.   This patch adds the driver
name, version and the config group name, to the log output,
so the admin can see which driver is failing.

Change-Id: I82e8aa969e7baa55db9c8dddc1c08db2a1a41091
Closes-Bug: #1259279

Can you use netaddr.EUI? In Nova, I was suggested to do so and actually did.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/51202/7/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/baremetal_nodes.py'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-12 12:15:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Arata,

Thank you for the suggestion, I think that this change might fit in another patch to make the is_valid_mac() function use the netaddr library for the validation instead having our own regex. This patch just make use of the is_valid_mac() and do not modify it.

Also, I didn't like much that validation, it tweaked the eui48 to make it looks like the unix dialect, maybe that would be better as:

In [1]: class mac_dialect(netaddr.mac_unix):
   ....:     word_fmt = '%.02x'
   ....:     

In [2]: netaddr.EUI('aa-aa-aa-aa-aa-aa', dialect=mac_dialect)
Out[2]: EUI('aa:aa:aa:aa:aa:aa')

In [3]: netaddr.EUI('a-a-a-a-a-a', dialect=mac_dialect)
Out[3]: EUI('0a:0a:0a:0a:0a:0a')

Even then, it looks just pretty complex. IMO I would keep the regex."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2013-12-12 12:46:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Right'}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
API: Validate and normalize address

On the API side, checks whether the supplied MAC address is formally
correct and normalize it to all lower case.

The patch also improves the docstring of the is_valid_mac function.

Change-Id: I6ae13888a9e17a10bba20acf829cbd01df535a3c
Closes-Bug: #1259269

commit_message:
API: Add sample() method on Port and PortCollection

Define sample() method on Port and PortCollection API objects to provide
sample data for generating the JSON and XML examples in the output of
the auto-documentation.

Also, PEP8-fy imports in port.py.

Change-Id: Ia19a2d79509d4cc820e9dea64d5c2c92dc9b3d2a
Partial-Bug: #1260337

Gordon, do you know what these options do?
At present, I do not think we want these options. For example,
we probably do not want to ignore the errors. If you think
that some of the options are important, then you can add them
in the future. Right now, I do not think we need them.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-12-10 18:31:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

http://nedbatchelder.com/code/coverage/config.html

it might be better to just copy it. for one, adding the source option checks for unexecuted files as well (something you don't get if you don't specify it.)

also, moving omit opt to [run] section might be cleaner since adding it to [report] section means it's being run, just not being reported.

are you against any of these settings? don't really see a point to having subsequent patch if it's just going to overwrite everything here."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-12-11 15:45:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-12-11 15:45:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
test code should be excluded from test coverage summary

Since the recent movement of the test code directory, now entire test
code is included in the test coverage summary, it makes a rather
strange loop, test code in the summary also shows being tested or
not tested. This patch will fix the problem so that the test
coverage summary will not show the coverage percentage for test code.

Change-Id: Ibbb4a009f01515befdd7045d6eec1afaf24ca99f

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: Ieae9d6f642d8ef93c699d434698c53fc1fa4e3eb

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: Id1e83aa5dd7c39d4827baeb39827b0ddeb8b6d4a

'}, {'created': '2013-12-11 16:33:08.000000000', 'message': "use_stderr should be False for tox tests

Reverting the change to the trove.test.conf so that the tox tests are
not so verbose with all the logging when running through the tests. It
makes it very difficult to find out what failed and where without much
groking of the output.

This was a change i made so that when you do a './redstack start-fake'

commit_message:
use_stderr should be False for tox tests

Reverting the change to the trove.test.conf so that the tox tests are
not so verbose with all the logging when running through the tests. It
makes it very difficult to find out what failed and where without much
groking of the output.

This was a change i made so that when you do a './redstack start-fake'
it would show the logs in the screen session. But this turned out to be
a bad idea when running in tox.

Change-Id: I236b2de2e89e49fd937d917d2955fddb5fb35d6f

'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-10-01 18:49:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

David, is this patch still needed? It needs at least rebasing...'}, {'account_id': 6534, 'date': '2013-10-02 12:06:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes this document is still valid. I know that all the other docs on api changes for federation have timed out, but this is due to several factors including summer holidays, other academic work to do (like marking dissertations), students leaving, and waiting for my next project funding to arrive later this month. I expect within the next few weeks to (re-)activate the other federation specs that we have authored:

i) the generic federation api
ii) the profile for SAML
iii) the profile for ABFAB

some people in Brazil have added OpenID Connect (Oauthv2) to our federation code, so I would really like to get the spec for this published as well'}, {'account_id': 9162, 'date': '2013-11-11 05:16:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Install Guide: add a chapter about client commands

This new chapter is taken from the common/ section, and explains how to
install clients on machines outside the OpenStack cluster. The install
guide can be misleading about how to use clients to administrate the
cloud, adding this section will hopefully help clarifying this.

pom.xml is modified to add an audience target (installer), used to build
specific parts of the common files.

backport: none
Change-Id: Ib4187d86bb2e3d7d9a26df426e17b4f4039a90fa

commit_message:
Sync db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator

This updates db.sqlalchemy from oslo-incubator from hash
6f3e5a57aea5402031c4cc8863e0e35f7f222794

 $ python update.py --nodeps --base keystone \
    --dest-dir ../keystone --modules db.sqlalchemy

Change-Id: I2c8c104b6116f3f0cf0f17df196924ab7c20e072

commit_message:
wsgi: remove

This module isn't used by anything now, and has been deprecated and
orphaned for a long time. It's time to end its suffering.

Good bye!

Change-Id: Id86f96b9286e6e98e94541b90bd5fe39e7279ca1

'}, {'account_id': 6268, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a real problem with asserting the exception messages. I think that is really unnecessary and adds complication to refactoring code. It does not add anything to our test suite to test what amounts to logging statements."}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:26:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Exception message asertions are very usefull, because each method could have >1  thrown exceptions. And refacored code by default should break existing tests, since project follows it's own exceptions hierarchy with different messages for each of them.
Simple question: we have method, which throws 10 different exceptions with non-flat hierarchy (method thrown exception A, which throws exception B and C and you catching their parent class TroveError). How do you know which exception was caught? That is why i used examine step where it was needed.
And reason when refactoring would be complicated because tests are not flexible to swallow any changes in code which should be tested is not acceptable.
More restrictions in tests we have more complicated would be task to brake existing code. And as i said, code should not be flexible for better/easier testsing. And unit testing would should be more strict to give insurance in code/implementation stability."}, {'account_id': 739, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:47:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Do not merge

in the meeting we said do not do this.'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-12-12 16:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8415, 'date': '2013-12-12 17:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned'}]

assertTrue(a in b), instead of assertIn(a, b) etc;

commit_message:
Updating unit test assertions

Reason:
- unit tests contains next assertions:
 assertThat with  matcher;
 assert isinstance(a, b) instead of assertIsInstance(value, type).
 assertTrue(a in b), instead of assertIn(a, b), assertNotIn.
 assertEqual(v, None), instead of assertIsNone or assertIsNotNone.
 testtools.ExceptionExpected (made for Py2.5 compability) changed to assertRaises

Changes:
- updating assertions.

Change-Id: Ifec29f8da68a906f2a1a0abae6a74d5920f0eac6
Closes-Bug: 1259938

Gary, sorry it's taken me a while to get back to this.  I think I led you astray on earlier comments.  I'm only familiar with the xenapi driver, but the memory_mb_used value reported includes overhead and all of the powered-on instances.  I believe this means we will double potentially double count a lo t of the memory usage here.

What do you think of moving a sanity check and warning to the end of the update_available_resource calculations instead?  It would then be a check to see if the computed usage is less than the *actual* usage, which would either indicate that something was out of sync with resource tracker or the reserve may have been improperly sized.

There's not currently a good way to compare only the reserve/overhead memory in xenapi without adding the information separately to the driver."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-10-31 19:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi,
No problem. We have listed this as a topic that we would like to speak about at one of the nova unconference sessions. I guess that we could iron out the details there (hopefully).
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-10-31 19:32:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Cool,  I won't be in HK, but please let me know if I can help out somehow."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-08 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-08 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

So this change will cause a lot of log output.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-11-13 12:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-11-13 13:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-11-25 21:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hmmm…the code looks OK, but it seems the tests are gone; is there any particular reason for the tests to have been eliminated?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-11-27 10:34:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The original changes that made changed the functionality. There was a lot of discussion around that and at the end we came to the conclusion just to log a warning if there are differences.
At the summit we spoke about having a configuration variable that will indicate to the resource tracker to use the host stats instead of calculating them from the db.
We are int he process of writing up the BP for this (sorry for all of the blah b;ah)
In short I am not really sure of how to test that a message is logged.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-12-02 23:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I would probably use something like the following:

    @mock.patch.object(resource_tracker, 'LOG')
    def test_…(self, mock_LOG):
        …
        mock_LOG.warning.assert_called_once_with(
            '…')"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-12-12 14:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Not convinced by the logic in here"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-12-12 15:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Do not merge

I think Phil has the right of it.  I think the attempt here is to create some better initial values for memory and disk before factoring in all the resource usage for the nova instances.  

However, at least on xenapi (and perhaps other drivers), the values in resources taken from the driver already include the resource usage from the instances, so I think this would just double count all those values.

We would need some kind of additional field(s) in resources to report just the host and compute VM overhead separately if this was going to work.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-12 16:41:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

All that this patch does is just log if the configured value is less than the actual value. It is not really clear how one comes up with the initial value in the configuration.
Not really sure how to proceed here so I am going to abandon this'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-12-12 16:42:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Resource tracking ignores used disk and memory

The resource tracking would not take into account the actual used
disk and memory stats from the host.

If the returned memory or disk space is greater than the
statically configured memory or disk space then a warning message
will be logged so that the administrator can address this accordingly.

Change-Id: I9f093c8eb0fdf6951121e54fd8ef9a72cc2bf117
Closes-Bug: #1242645

We are handling https://review.openstack.org/60376 separately. Since this patch no longer depends on the oslo-incubator code, and we can pull it in later, I'm happy with this for now."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-12-09 23:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

clayton I am really loathed to -1 at this point. But *if* you need to post this again you could remove the wrap_exception and safeutils as they are not directly a part of the object code. We could re-add just before using it.'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-10 02:44:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm really confused; isn't this the thing that we agreed would go into oslo.incubator rather than being cloned between trees?"}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2013-12-10 03:18:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

lifeless: this patch set has been pared down. The current patch set is just the minimum we need for database functionality in Solum, and the Nova based object code is going through review in oslo-incubator. Once it is merged over there, we can pull that pack in here as well.'}, {'account_id': 9094, 'date': '2013-12-10 19:28:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Minor nit in an inline comment.'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-12-10 22:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-11 00:17:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

Sorry to be 'that guy', but the commit message hasn't changed at all - so either the paring down isn't that much, or this is still a big chunk of copied nova code.

Is much delay expected with the olso import? Given it's meant to support iteration I've have thought the initial entry would be low-key?"}, {'account_id': 668, 'date': '2013-12-11 00:41:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (1 inline comment)

Tracked a bug to revisit possible XSS vulnerability based on future implementation:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/solum/+bug/1259761

We can merge without addressing this now, because this will only become a problem if we fail to do proper input validation.'}, {'account_id': 9124, 'date': '2013-12-11 22:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

@lifeless The commit message didn't change much because the Nova code was offering a fundamental capability (remotability) but wasn't terribly coupled with the parts that are left.  The object registry idea is a pattern (accessor on a registry object => class implementation) with very little code, the rest is specific to Solum.  The nova exception code is currently copied into a number of projects in slightly different ways - that was a separate import that Angus and I went over reviewed and ended up being much closer to Heat's final state.

Since remotability and schema versioning with remote object hydration isn't deeply coupled with having an object model (at various peoples' comments we've pared it down to be very "simple Python") my preference was to split that aspect out until we a) get it up stream and b) need it ourselves.'}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-12-11 23:02:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Some suggestions inline... I'm fine with these being addressed in a followup patch, but I am going to -1 this just for a moment to make sure my comments show up on the radar..."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2013-12-11 23:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Add simple application interface and object registry

solum/objects/__init__.py supports loading and initializing a set of
associations between public interfaces (solum/objects/application.py,
etc) and private implementations. By default, backends are loaded
as packages, with a load() method on the package module expected to
handle invoking solum.objects.registry.put(name,cls) for each
implementation. A new config flag "backend" is loaded under the
"database" group to represent the persistence backend type.

The common exception and initialization code is based on nova commit
93efad46aa1cbb9aef68561aca49278ef7584983, with slight tweaks for
Solum.

Change-Id: If33965825ce4978106e7021d62b16688d28fa29e

The removal of the logic of what the "|| /bin/true" was doing caught my eye on this one.

That was added in:  https://review.openstack.org/#q,I38a18af09ab24fda9c98cbf3ace8fd7acc6faef5

However, afaict, that was never doing what it was intended to do, because I don't see how the basename call could have been failing the script.

e.g., basename does not fail this script you see "Done" (I don't have any PAE kernels installed):

 #!/bin/bash
 set -e
 BOOTDIR=/boot
 basename `ls -1rv $BOOTDIR/vmlinuz*`  | grep PAE | grep -v debug | head -1
 echo "Done"

so, this should be good to merge.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-12-09 15:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

link above should be:
I8971ec0bbcd87157b07fc17254c56bb9f9f2a597

(outsmarted by gerrit).'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-12-09 15:04:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Let's try that one more time:

I38a18af09ab24fda9c98cbf3ace8fd7acc6faef5"}, {'account_id': 7419, 'date': '2013-12-09 15:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-12-09 15:40:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

James, the reason your example works is that you call basename before running the filtering.  What the code was doing is more like this:

basename `ls -1rv $BOOTDIR/vmlinuz* | grep PAE | grep -v debug | head -1`

Which does fail.

That said, it's not relevant anymore in this change because basename isn't called until after we know $KERNEL was set, so the change lgtm."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2013-12-09 15:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ah, i see now.  i missed the location of that last backtick.  thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-10 02:03:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

[{'created': '2013-12-09 13:01:16.000000000', 'message': "Quieten disk-image-get-kernel

disk-image-get-kernel is pretty noisey and you see e.g.:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  XXX  -d '/tmp/image.lWGCgPoj' -o 'tmp' -i '/home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2' --
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 and writing them to /tmp/image.lWGCgPoj
  nbd                    17554  0
  nbd                    17554  0
  basename: missing operand
  Try 'basename --help' for more information.
  /dev/nbd0 disconnected
  tmp-vmlinuz,tmp-initrd

Clean all this up so we just get:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 to tmp-vmlinuz and tmp-initrd in /tmp/image.g6b0lG88

Change-Id: I8971ec0bbcd87157b07fc17254c56bb9f9f2a597

commit_message:
Quieten disk-image-get-kernel

disk-image-get-kernel is pretty noisy and you see e.g.:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  XXX  -d '/tmp/image.lWGCgPoj' -o 'tmp' -i '/home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2' --
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 and writing them to /tmp/image.lWGCgPoj
  nbd                    17554  0
  nbd                    17554  0
  basename: missing operand
  Try 'basename --help' for more information.
  /dev/nbd0 disconnected
  tmp-vmlinuz,tmp-initrd

Clean all this up so we just get:

  $> load-image overcloud-compute.qcow2
  Extracting kernel + ramdisk from /home/stack/overcloud-compute.qcow2 to tmp-vmlinuz and tmp-initrd in /tmp/image.g6b0lG88

Change-Id: I8971ec0bbcd87157b07fc17254c56bb9f9f2a597

commit_message:
vmware driver selection of vm_folder_ref.

causes the vmFolder target in vCenter to be calculated based on the datastore selected

fixes bug: 1214850
addresses bug: 1180044

Change-Id: Iadde4c5e10bdeaa24aac3ecde278fe992a89be4b

commit_message:
Handle DBDuplicateEntry on Ports with same address

Handle the DBDuplicateEntry exception when creating/updating ports with
the same address and raise MACAlreadyExists to give user a better feedback
about the problem.

Change-Id: I87feb27776bb2fee2a4a6b28f9468e235063f5f7
Closes-Bug: #1257673

commit_message:
Move to stackforge

Update URLs in the documentation for the source and
bug tracker.

Add a .gitreview file to make reviews work.

Change the "style" tox env to "pep8" to be consistent with
the check job expectations.

commit_message:
Implementing scalable Mistral Engine

* Asynchronous tasks
* Separate stateless task executors
* Notification of task executors via RabbitMQ

TODO:
* DB transaction management
* Analyzing graph of tasks to identify what should be started
* Thorough automated tests

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-poc
Partially implements blueprint: mistral-workflow-execution
Partially implements blueprint: mistral-engine-ha

Change-Id: I022e1b73b9a3c58f1fbc259ba3e5995acd2bf6c3

commit_message:
Add extra swift features

Enable various swift middleware and options, a default tempest run is
expecting these to be present. With these changes all of the swift
tempest tests pass.

Also reordered the sections in proxy-server.conf to match the pipeline
order and removed the proxy-logging section which was unused.

Change-Id: I12406d5b64fb4595a0498abb8d50d2e33f88a147

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 12:45:41.000000000', 'message': 'Cosmetic change to cleanup output

Cleanup failures turned out to be a pretty common thing since there may be
dozens of different cloud configurations and it is not trivial to implement
a single cleanup strategy that would work for all of them. This patch makes
the log output in case of a cleanup failure somewhat less affright.

Change-Id: Ibff9edaada9b8a6d69575d6702ab6ea4f2192f8a
Related-Bug: #1260059
'}]
commit_message:
Cosmetic change to cleanup output

Cleanup failures turned out to be a pretty common thing since there may be
dozens of different cloud configurations and it is not trivial to implement
a single cleanup strategy that would work for all of them. This patch makes
the log output in case of a cleanup failure somewhat less affright.

Change-Id: Ibff9edaada9b8a6d69575d6702ab6ea4f2192f8a
Related-Bug: #1260059

Package name fixed

We decided to not include murano-cirros-testvm package as the new image
 was moved to cirros-testvm package.

Closes-Bug: 1260252

Change-Id: I1aebbf0f0e25970cdcf0658adbe752e895714309

commit_message:
Remove unused flag 'host_state_interval'

Patch I749204d7d6461993d0c42bf5877b65c5ec17c62f removed periodic task
`_report_driver_status()`, which fanout this host's capabilities to
nova scheduler. So the flag 'host_state_interval' is not used.
Just remove it in this patch.

DocImpact: the 'host_state_interval' flag has been removed. It was last used in
grizzly and was not used in havana.

Change-Id: Ieb047ccb33cdecc6f25b6ae128dcac4e1c00cd98

subject: Fix comparison with singletons
messages: [{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2013-12-12 13:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\nwrongly changed Change-Id'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 13:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n*) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: Id6454e872d5147e1fa05a528dea3c17ee9b6262d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix comparison with singletons

Many plases in tests code use assertEqual(AA, None),
the same with True and False and negatives of such comparisons.

As comparison to singletons must use `is` operator, appropriate usage
is assertIs, assertIsNot, assertIsNone, assertIsNotNone

These assertions are provided by the `testtools` package,
so this change is not breaking backward compatibility with Python 2.6

This first patch inlcudes roughly half of the files touched by these changes
(up to and including test_n*) to ease the review.

Partial-Bug: #1259023

Change-Id: Id6454e872d5147e1fa05a528dea3c17ee9b6262d

[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:30:42.000000000', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 12:11:01.000000000', 'message': "Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

commit_message:
Add clean configuration files to upgrade from H to I

Any new configurations for Icehouse should go in one of the upgrade files in
from-havana directory.
Also moves {BASE,TARGET}_RELEASE vars forward to Havana->Icehouse pair.

Change-Id: Iac520a8de4c3b9f14e2289cfb9b6a50c4ab0ce32

commit_message:
added selective node deployment/provisioning

Detailed description
* added node selection on deployment/provisioning actions
  e.g. downloading/uploading of facts for specific nodes
  rather than downloading facts for all nodes
* fixed spelling

Implements: blueprint cli-separate-rpovisioning-and-deployment

Change-Id: I5eb3fca4cd3e0cd7db8bf573c321d4b3db93524a

commit_message:
Fix for doc formatting bug and small update to ISO build doc

Closes-Bug: #1260246

We need to remove nodejs and nodejs-legacy packages before installing nodejs
from the PPA repo in order to avoid conflicts with old system packages.
We also should not try to install "npm" package since it's a part of new nodejs

Change-Id: I5a5386317ba3ab8915bf0da089eab12e499fdb5a

commit_message:
Fix wrong vif driver by default

Some changes have been done in Nova to have generic drivers:
http://tinyurl.com/VifDriver

This patchs aims to:
- Change default driver
- Rename unit tests files for using Neutron name instead of Quantum (depcrecated)

Closes-bug 1259139
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
Change-Id: I6dd7766a1f99221927d3143d14da80fb0be16211

commit_message:
Fixing neutron::server connection parameter

Previously, neutron::server's (deprecated) sql_connection parameter
had a default value, preventing the new/preferred connection
parameter from ever being used.

This change removes that default, permitting the connection
parameter to work properly, and extends unit tests to confirm.

bug introduced at commit 82552e79316a4ffc1c879dd3aaa1f4735a4a35a0,
change I300fc12092bca1abdd105e0c0c272f7fd49258ac

Change-Id: I116b482c620b5c44b88c1b801438a100343f6f9f

On python 2.6 module unittests do not have
SkipTest attribute - it is available only on 2.7

Also delete initialization of ceilometer client,
according it broke all ostf in case if ceilometer do
not installed

Change-Id: Iefc302e4d6860b3e3ce6951902c166b197257175
Close-bug: bug/1260199
'}]
commit_message:
Fix attribute error in adapter

On python 2.6 module unittests do not have
SkipTest attribute - it is available only on 2.7

Also delete initialization of ceilometer client,
according it broke all ostf in case if ceilometer do
not installed

Change-Id: Iefc302e4d6860b3e3ce6951902c166b197257175
Close-bug: bug/1260199

[{'created': '2013-12-11 21:11:02.000000000', 'message': 'Change default API auth to keystone-based

Current default setting of auth_strategy=noauth
is not a sane default for our users.

Switch to keystone-based authentication.

Change-Id: I11163eff24d185a1af52eb58e70bb53beb3ce84d
'}]
commit_message:
Change default API auth to keystone-based

Current default setting of auth_strategy=noauth
is not a sane default for our users.

Switch to keystone-based authentication.

Change-Id: I11163eff24d185a1af52eb58e70bb53beb3ce84d

This is required as without this nova doesn't communicate to the keystone server generating an "Unauthorised (HTTP 401)" page when acceesing /admin/. At least when running DevStack in All-In-One mode on hardware.

Change-Id: Ibf4d9d1c21081a1e3de4ea765f4db6de5fbdb237
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 00:11:39.000000000', 'message': 'Modified the create_nova_conf function to add the $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT to the keystone_authtoken section.
This is required as without this nova doesn't communicate to the keystone server generating an "Unauthorised (HTTP 401)" page when acceesing /admin/. At least when running DevStack in All-In-One mode on hardware.

Change-Id: Ibf4d9d1c21081a1e3de4ea765f4db6de5fbdb237
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 02:26:14.000000000', 'message': 'Added keystone auth port to the nova config

Added the $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT to the keystone_authtoken
section of the create_nova_conf function.
This is required as without it nova doesn't communicate
to the keystone server. Generating an "Unauthorised (HTTP 401)"
page when acceesing /admin/.

Change-Id: Ibf4d9d1c21081a1e3de4ea765f4db6de5fbdb237
'}]
commit_message:
Added keystone auth port to the nova config

Added the $KEYSTONE_AUTH_PORT to the keystone_authtoken
section of the create_nova_conf function.
This is required as without it nova doesn't communicate
to the keystone server. Generating an "Unauthorised (HTTP 401)"
page when acceesing /admin/.

Change-Id: Ibf4d9d1c21081a1e3de4ea765f4db6de5fbdb237

commit_message:
Make parameter doc RDoc compatible

The patch fixes the parameter documentation in
api, cert, compute and client to conform with
the style guide and support autogenerating
paramter documentation.

Change-Id: I94c6807a18be5eb27697eaa060a0e885a7d44cbe

commit_message:
Qemu emulator requires at least 128MB of memory to boot on ppc64

The default nano and micro flavors need more memory to boot on
ppc64. New flavors are 128MB and 256MB, respectively.
Trailing spaces removed, again.

Change-Id: Ic6740bda959754380982e67f753876dc6d984685

commit_message:
Separate negative tests in flavors/test_flavors

Separate negative tests to their own file. Restructured
invalid_id and nonexistent_id tests.

bp negative-test-files

[{'created': '2013-10-11 12:16:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes python-swiftclient debugging message

Appends the container's name to the URL displayed, to be used to
replay the queries with curl.

Replaying the curl commands displayed by "swift --debug list
<container>" now works properly.

Example:
$ swift --debug list test-container
...
DEBUG:swiftclient:REQ: curl -i http://10.0.48.134:8080/v1/AUTH_6c554b8dd3d74e44878eddb92caf8687/test-container?format=json -X GET -H ...
...

Change-Id: I7ec33d185fedc44a529c016d38f841fde39d20d0
Closes-Bug: #1238612
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes python-swiftclient debugging message

Appends the container's name to the URL displayed, to be used to
replay the queries with curl.

Replaying the curl commands displayed by "swift --debug list
<container>" now works properly.

Example:
$ swift --debug list test-container
...
DEBUG:swiftclient:REQ: curl -i http://10.0.48.134:8080/v1/AUTH_6c554b8dd3d74e44878eddb92caf8687/test-container?format=json -X GET -H ...
...

Change-Id: I7ec33d185fedc44a529c016d38f841fde39d20d0
Closes-Bug: #1238612

commit_message:
update documentation with specific of rax setup

because I spent way too long figuring this out, here is the patch
to describe what the various settings need to be to make this
work with rax cloud and upstream nova-client.

Change-Id: I7de5d18ff3d850507103ef5f896e79e0ab1c39b4

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2013-12-11 23:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I might be missing something, but I don't think this patch works:

We are using the Tempest ReST client (https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/services/network/json/network_client.py) which has only one create_router method: https://gist.github.com/miguellavalle/7920403

In order to specify an external gateway in the request body, we need something like (per http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-network/2.0/content/router_create.html):

"external_gateway_info" :
{
"network_id": <external_network_uuid>
}

An example of creating a router with an external gateway using the Tempest ReST client client can be found in https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/network/test_routers.py. The router creation can be seen here: https://gist.github.com/miguellavalle/7920646'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-12 01:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

So it looks like minsel is right here, sorry for the oversight, -2'ing to prevent the merge.

I believe that both Sean and I were relying on the gate jobs to verify the API semantics here. So I'm more curious why this was able to pass the gate check and neutron didn't return a 400 for a badly formatted request."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-12-12 01:47:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi

I'm using create_router in base class. (see

commit_message:
Fix Neutron VPNaaS Test

VPNService requires Router is connected to external gateway.
In this commit, we connected the test router to external network.

Change-Id: Ib87583219efd8efd959c9c7edb813c3a70e7d20c
Closes-Bug:1259282

See requirements commit 0e8862e958813a031fe7398440e8a3866b42a8e4
for details.

Related-Bug: 1259511
Change-Id: I4a13685c4efe6ea80ef69e879bb2adc104fa564f

commit_message:
Pin sphinx to <1.2

There is a bug in sphinx 1.2 that breaks doc builds.

See requirements commit 0e8862e958813a031fe7398440e8a3866b42a8e4
for details.

Related-Bug: 1259511
Change-Id: I4a13685c4efe6ea80ef69e879bb2adc104fa564f

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2 in test-requirements

Sphinx was pinned to <1.2 in neutron requirements and we also
need to pin sphinx in neutronclient test-requirements.

Change-Id: I923cd19b3c28f9784a746243a5b3f76f7c38524c

commit_message:
Remove useless api sample template files for flavor-rxtx v3

flavor-rxtx template files flavor-get-resp.* and flavors-detail-resp.*
isn't used by any api sample test. So remove them.

Change-Id: I74760bcd5367487aca31cdf94fa5e5715f19f4c6

Thanks for your work Andy. Hope the build logs were helpful :)

Just for future reference: we tend not to write about the updates between patchsets in the commit message. This is because only the final code (and commit message) is merged, so the update references lose their meaning at that point. The preference seems to be to write about the changes between patchsets by posting a comment on the review.'}, {'account_id': 8944, 'date': '2013-12-12 04:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2013-12-12 07:55:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

The change itself is fine, thanks!

For next time, please improve your commit message as explained at: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

Especially:
* The first line (Title) should be limited to 50 characters and should not end with a period.
* Subsequent lines should be wrapped at 72 characters. 

Don't mention what you update between changes, add that information as review comments instead. We do not need the information on how the patch evolved in the commit message for a review of just the patch."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-12 08:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

commit_message:
Clarified location of driver config settings; removed ESX driver reference; minor text edits.

UPDATED part 3: Build failed! fixed program listing tags
UPDATED part 2: Build failed. Checked and modified tag formatting.
UPDATED: Removed tabs and applied correct use of <filename> tags.

* Clarified details of volume driver configuration settings for VMDK drivers in nova.conf and cinder.conf.

* Removed reference to ESX/ESXi server driver config because it has not been extensively tested.

* Changed occurrences of "data store" to "datastore" for consistency.

Change-Id: I2a45b131fa19749530f5fe93115518f8b9f4ea4e
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1260005

commit_message:
Add decorator expected_errors for flavors_extraspecs v3

This patch add decorator expected_errors and also add catching
for FlavorNotFound.

Partially implements bp nova-v3-api

DocImpact

Change-Id: I56556871f649ba56211d3f523a184e3171dd3b7e

commit_message:
TTL mechanism support with expirer service

Aims to support a TTL mechanism for data entering Ceilometer
collector database.
TTL is very useful to configure when getting a lot of meters.

implement blueprint ttl-support
Change-Id: I9d98e8b833ad94fd79722dee7226e7f4f03aaa2e
(cherry picked from commit 0af224916f085166d5ccd104e90cbc680039063d)
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
allow configdrive vs. metadata server to be configured

this gives us control of the config drive settings in devstack so
that we can force it off, to ensure that we are using the
metadata server instead for configuring the guests.

Needed because neutron does some extra clever things with the
metadata server setup which got broken because we were defaulting
to config drive in all the runs.

Depends-On: Ic2acb568b55a05b84120b181383ea45ea190dcad

Change-Id: Ib203bb0c812939f32b36731464b18566a187c85a

Unfortunately I've uncovered a number of issues with thin snaps.  The PPA that I have from brightbox for precise works as expected, however the default version in saucy is broken and I suspect it may be broken in newer versions of LVM2.

Creating a thin-snap of a thin-snap appears to have a bug requesting a size be specified.  Sizes should not be specified for thin-snaps (-L or -V), they should be left as allocating zero bytes.

Anyway, I'll have to spend some time looking at these issues so marking this as WIP for now."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-12-04 06:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

[{'created': '2013-12-03 00:23:16.000000000', 'message': "Don't dd bytes to thin LVM for clone operations

In Cinder to clone a volume we typically take a snapshot
of an LVM, create a new volume and dd the contents of the
snap to the new volume, then delete the snap.

For linear LVM this is fine because there's a signficant
performance penalty for having snapshots of an LVM volume.

With LVM thin however this isn't the case as all the data blocks
are shared in the pool.  This means we can create and actually use
snapshots, and delete parent LV's without issue.

This change implements the use of snapshots for operations like
clone (create from volume) and create from snapshot.  Rather than
do the intermediate snapshot and dd, we just create an LVM snapshot
with the volume properties and use it.

Change-Id: I9c7a06168dba97d1477e9500e2651c3f8a44b42a
Closes-Bug: #1224671
"}, {'created': '2013-12-03 05:22:02.000000000', 'message': "Don't dd bytes to thin LVM for clone operations

Change-Id: I9c7a06168dba97d1477e9500e2651c3f8a44b42a

commit_message:
Don't dd bytes to thin LVM for clone operations

In Cinder to clone a volume we typically take a snapshot
of an LVM, create a new volume and dd the contents of the
snap to the new volume, then delete the snap.

For linear LVM this is fine because there's a signficant
performance penalty for having snapshots of an LVM volume.

With LVM thin however this isn't the case as all the data blocks
are shared in the pool.  This means we can create and actually use
snapshots, and delete parent LV's without issue.

This change implements the use of snapshots for operations like
clone (create from volume) and create from snapshot.  Rather than
do the intermediate snapshot and dd, we just create an LVM snapshot
with the volume properties and use it.

Change-Id: I9c7a06168dba97d1477e9500e2651c3f8a44b42a
Closes-Bug: #1224671

commit_message:
Add eclipse project files to .gitignore

Like some of the other projects(nova,cinder,glance,heat,oslo),
git ignores eclipse project files(.project, .pydevproject).

This will remove manual steps for developing from eclipse.

Fixes bug: 1257616

Change-Id: I6f36196190b1878843a6d8e706bba8d6d958c282

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-03 22:13:23.000000000', 'message': 'Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: Ifae6900177ae402dd6c62c71c1fb4712562362d0
Partial-Bug: #1246852
'}]
commit_message:
Stale kvm processes when using libguestfs

When setting up images for nova there is insufficient error handling
when using libguestfs which leaves stale kvm processes on the compute
node.  These stale processes consume CPU and memory and can starve a
compute node of resources.  The stale processes are not reaped when the
instance that triggered the libguestfs injection is deleted.

Change-Id: Ifae6900177ae402dd6c62c71c1fb4712562362d0
Partial-Bug: #1246852

messages:
[{'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-02-19 01:50:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Few issues here.

Possible security issues shouldn't be discussed in the open.
First create a security bug. Too late now, but we'd need
a bug for this anyway. If there is a downstream public
bug for this then it should be linked too.

chmod won't cut it due to races.
You'll need to open(...,mode) or more generally use umask.

Also this change may cause knock on permission issues,
like with instance directories on NFS etc.
It might be appropriate to just otherwise restrict
access to the instances directory?

This change only seems to impact the image info files,
rather than the image files themselves?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-19 02:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-04 15:29:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

David:

I'm seeing consistent failures for this in SmokeStack:

libvirtError: internal error Process exited while reading console log output: chardev: opening backend "file".

Also, my thought is that this is something distributions (packages) should be doing... and doesn't really belong in Nova right?'}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-03-04 15:35:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

Dan, I see that failure in devstack-gate as well.  There I think it's that the user that owns /usr/stack/data isn't the same user that's running the devstack process.  I have a pending fix in devstack for it.

I think the fix does need to be in nova; we can't rely on distributions to clean up after our mess.  It's correct in glance, for example."}, {'account_id': 5652, 'date': '2013-03-04 15:37:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

'}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-09-26 10:49:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

Apparently it isn't as easy as it looks. By changing the instances directory permissions to 751 (leaving o+x so libvirt can work with the instances inside) the instances we store there are still readable by others unless we restrict the permissions of those files too (it's done in the patch by changing the umask before creating them).

Now the problem is that if we protect the base images by making them not accessible for others, when we start an instance libvirt will take ownership of its base image (e.g. with user qemu group qemu in fedora) and make it inaccessible for nova. This prevents starting any other instance using the same image. The same happens with nova's periodic resources task which reads the disk usage from the images.

To work around all this I could update all the calls to qemu-img to use rootwrap but I'm not 100% convinced it's the ideal solution."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-09-26 11:23:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 28:

IMHO using rootwrap is the right approach for Nova accessing any files that are owned by the QEMU user. We don't want any kind of shared UNIX group between Nova & QEMU, because those processes have very different trust levels - Nova is completely trusted, and QEMU is completely untrusted. A shared group allows bi-directional access to files between those two processes. Use of rootwrap only allows uni-directional access by Nova to QEMU, not the reverse."}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-09-27 13:31:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29.'}, {'account_id': 7808, 'date': '2013-09-27 13:39:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

I had my doubts but I think this solution looks more robust than the old one which was changing the group of the files.

In the new patch I've added a new decorator to all the methods that create files shared with libvirt which will prevent those from being world-readable. I've also updated all the calls that interact with an QEMU owned file to use rootwrap.

Because of its similarities I've applied the same solution to snapshots and included a fix for bug 1227027"}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-09-27 16:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'created': '2013-09-23 16:35:09.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files. The simplest way to ensure that they cannot is to
make the instances_path readable, writable and executable only by the
group libvirt uses for spawning new instances.

Because this group depends on each distribution we add a new
configuration option called 'libvirt_group' to let packagers and admins
to specify such group. For example, Ubuntu and Debian use the group 'kvm'
while RHEL and Fedora use the group 'qemu'.

Marking as DocImpact because this new option should be documented to let
know the packagers and administrators how to fix the issue.

Fixes bug 1129748

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
"}, {'created': '2013-09-25 11:53:56.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine
see our image files. With this patch the compute driver will take care
of changing the mode of the instances path so it is only readable by the
owner and set an adequate umask (0007) when creating the files for each
instance (disks, console log, ...).

This change also sets the executable flag for others to instances_path,
which is the only requirement so libvirt can access the contained files
for the instances.

Another issue with libvirt is that it sets the ownership of the images
to root after destroying the instance. This prevents further access from
nova if we have set previously a stric file mode. This patch will change
the ownership of those files to the nova user once the instance is destroyed.

Fixes bug 1129748

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
'}, {'created': '2013-09-25 13:03:13.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

This change also sets the executable flag for others to instances_path,
which is the only requirement so libvirt can access the contained files

Another issue with libvirt is that it sets the ownership of the images
to root after destroying the instance. This prevents further access from
nova if we have set previously a stric file mode. This patch will change
the ownership of those files to the nova user once the instance is destroyed.

Fixes bug 1129748

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
'}, {'created': '2013-09-25 13:12:43.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that instances_path is not world readable

It could be a slight security problem to let every user on the machine

This change also sets the executable flag for others to instances_path,

Another issue with libvirt is that it sets the ownership of the images

Fixes bug 1129748

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
'}, {'created': '2013-09-27 13:31:14.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that libvirt files are not world readable

The files that nova shares with libvirt and QEMU may contain user
sensitive information and it might be a problem if those files are
visible for all the users in the machine. These files include the images
under instances_dir, the base images and snapshots.

This patch introduces a new decorator that will change the user
file-creation mask temporarily during the call of a method, allowing
us to mark methods that shouldn't create world readable files thus
protecting them.

Also in this patch, all the calls that interact with libvirt owned files
have been modified to use rootwrap so they can still access these files
(for resizing an image, snapshoting a disk or migrating an instance).

Fixes bug 1129748
Fixes bug 1227027

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4

Fixes bug 1129748
Fixes bug 1227027

Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4
"}, {'created': '2013-11-27 16:00:34.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that libvirt files are not world readable

The files that nova shares with libvirt and QEMU may contain user
sensitive information and it might be a problem if those files are
visible for all the users in the machine. These files include the images

This patch introduces a new decorator that will change the user

us to mark methods that shouldn't create world readable files thus

Also in this patch, all the calls that interact with libvirt owned files
have been modified to use rootwrap so they can still access these files
(for resizing an image, snapshoting a disk or migrating an instance).

As a side effect, by setting the proper permissions to libvirt files and
accessing them using rootwrap, this patch avoids problems with cached file
attributes that might trigger problems as the one described in bug 1218372

Closes-Bug: #1129748

Closes-Bug: #1227027
Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4

commit_message:
Ensure that libvirt files are not world readable

The files that nova shares with libvirt and QEMU may contain user
sensitive information and it might be a problem if those files are
visible for all the users in the machine. These files include the images
under instances_dir, the base images and snapshots.

This patch uses the decorator introduced in the previous patch, which
will change the user file-creation mask temporarily, during the call of
a method, allowing us to mark methods that shouldn't create world
readable files and thus, protecting them.

Also in this patch, all the calls that interact with libvirt owned files
have been modified to use rootwrap so they can still access these files
(for resizing or creating an image or when migrating an instance).

As a side effect, by setting the proper permissions to libvirt files and
accessing them using rootwrap, this patch avoids problems with cached file
attributes that might trigger problems as the one described in bug 1218372

Closes-Bug: #1129748
Closes-Bug: #1227027
Change-Id: Ib290f8df20a9e29ed98faec221f607b685e26da4

'}, {'account_id': 7195, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If a user puts garbage in this field or it's empty or malformed or isn't locally routable, it will be rejected by the networking system. Why should we preserve possible garbage values? If a valid gateway is specified here, it will be marked in "ip route show" and report back correctly.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-12 06:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

[{'created': '2013-11-11 20:41:11.000000000', 'message': 'Derive default gateway from /etc/sysconfig/network

Parse default gateway from /etc/sysconfig/network before
you go to /proc/net/route

commit_message:
Derive default gateway from /etc/sysconfig/network

Parse default gateway from /etc/sysconfig/network before
you go to /proc/net/route

Change-Id: I1c19db5392c9b1ddf2f7e6a9a2387b78fde78ef4
Closes-bug: 1250211

'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-12-04 07:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Those options should go in cinder::backup::swift.

cinder::init is reserved for common options (re)used by cinder-volume, cinder-scheduler, cinder-backup, ... or any future service.'}, {'account_id': 7462, 'date': '2013-12-04 07:56:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks, i missed that class'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2013-12-04 16:12:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Already done: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58792/'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-12-04 16:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Nothing is "already done". This change introduces the ability to configure backup_swift_user, backup_swift_password and backup_swift_url. (in the wrong manifest)

cinder::backup::swift doesn't handle those configs yet:
https://github.com/stackforge/puppet-cinder/blob/master/manifests/backup/swift.pp

As cinder::backup does not (and shouldn't) handle any driver specific configurations, those configurations should be moved to cinder::backup::swift.'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-12-04 16:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In fact, backup_swift_url is already handled.'}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-12-04 16:49:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Well, Ivan should 'just' move the changes to the correct file and write the test for it. Test are mandatory for thechanges we made."}, {'account_id': 8083, 'date': '2013-12-04 16:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ok, more than add, integrate is the correct word.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-12 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-12-12 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Properly mock out image_utils operations for tests

Currently image_utils unit tests write data to the
"conversion" path.  This should be mocked out rather than
interacting with the actual file system.

image_utils.temporary_file() also appears to hide OSErrors -- fixed.

Closes-Bug: #1252502

Change-Id: I3fcb6c4cb39de2f9f009be93498f89987be04241

commit_message:
Fixed URL to noVNC repo.

devstack tries to clone noVNC from git.openstack.org.
Returned back to github.com.

Fixes bug #1257974

commit_message:
Ensure_resource on dnsmasq package

As dnsmasq is sometimes required by other modules,
in particular ones that are not in puppet-openstack,
this can cause duplicate declaration issues. By
using ensure_resource, we can avoid these problems
and both modules can declare the package.

Backport of I32f29bcac3cf67a2644b3e5eb50621f8e27b1cb1

Change-Id: Id7c66c20b62890df51c37f608087234a5b470eae

[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'Don't have tox install pre-release software

Override the tox pip install command to avoid using the "--pre" option
which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include pre-release and
development versions."  By default, pip will only install stable

Change-Id: I3aa2a69c5bae54932137c78cc711236a0ca24602
'}]
commit_message:
Don't have tox install pre-release software

Override the tox pip install command to avoid using the "--pre" option
which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include pre-release and
development versions."  By default, pip will only install stable
versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: I3aa2a69c5bae54932137c78cc711236a0ca24602

commit_message:
Add multi-worker support

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/37131/ got merged, Neutron
supports now multiple worker processes for API server.

Change-Id: Ib01240c39de21306892f4f92e0ba3ecb56837a7c
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
(cherry picked from commit 64c452b4fb8b955639bc57b483f619224a23be83)
Backport to havana: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60082/

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-12 03:40:23.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure_resource on dnsmasq package

As dnsmasq is sometimes required by other modules,
in particular ones that are not in puppet-openstack,
this can cause duplicate declaration issues. By
using ensure_resource, we can avoid these problems
and both modules can declare the package.

Change-Id: I32f29bcac3cf67a2644b3e5eb50621f8e27b1cb1
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure_resource on dnsmasq package

As dnsmasq is sometimes required by other modules,
in particular ones that are not in puppet-openstack,
this can cause duplicate declaration issues. By
using ensure_resource, we can avoid these problems
and both modules can declare the package.

Change-Id: I32f29bcac3cf67a2644b3e5eb50621f8e27b1cb1

commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: I5a57debd5c4bc03e6d00d3801be614d9b895c508

commit_message:
db: make compatible with SQLAlchemy 0.8

Argument assert_unicode is deprecated in SQLAlchemy 0.7.
Also it is removed from SQLAlchemy 0.8.
Arguments convert_unicode, unicode_error, and _warn_on_bytestring
seem to cause problems with SQLAlchemy 0.8.

Closes-bug: 1235829

Change-Id: I713dd446756398805404400d05b1d0927601dd97

"Bug fix: don’t strip a dotted extension from the path unless it has a matching mimetype."

http://pecan.readthedocs.org/en/latest/changes.html?highlight=dot

[{'created': '2013-11-18 15:57:47.000000000', 'message': "Extract suffix from req URL to avoid escaping dots

Usernames and their hosts can contain dots. As such,
user CRUD requests may end in ids that contain one
or more fullstops. Our request router can interpret
these as file suffixes and our methods and as a
result, truncates these ids improperly.

This change inspects the request object in these
cases, looks for a possibly misinterpreted suffix,
and reattaches the suffix to the id. This means
that escaping . in requests shouldn't be necessary.

commit_message:
Extract suffix from req URL to avoid escaping dots

Usernames and their hosts can contain dots. As such,
user CRUD requests may end in ids that contain one
or more fullstops. Our request router can interpret
these as file suffixes and our methods and as a
result, truncates these ids improperly.

This change inspects the request object in these
cases, looks for a possibly misinterpreted suffix,
and reattaches the suffix to the id. This means
that escaping . in requests shouldn't be necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1252327

Change-Id: I74c4d6694baba44ebe0018eedac2ae5c4773b370

commit_message:
Set the provision_state to DEPLOYFAIL

Set the provision_state to DEPLOYFAIL instead of ERROR when the deploy
failed. The DEPLOYFAIL state should be used for this problem specific
where ERROR is more generic.

Change-Id: I87c75dd8be46950792643303f79d57f9a7da9d0d

[{'created': '2013-12-10 14:56:38.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up duplicated change-building code in objects

Almost every object thus far has done this:

  updates = {}
  changes = self.obj_what_changed()
  for field in changes:
        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds
that as part of the base object and makes every place that does
the above to just use that.

Change-Id: I8d2616ecc2c88cf4b21e7e8193f5b985407ed869
Closes-Bug: #1259527

Almost every object thus far has done this:

  updates = {}
  changes = self.obj_what_changed()

        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds

It's a port from a patch in nova ,link to the origional patch:

Change-Id: I8d2616ecc2c88cf4b21e7e8193f5b985407ed869
Closes-Bug: #1259527

commit_message:
Clean up duplicated change-building code in objects

Almost every object thus far has done this:

  updates = {}
  changes = self.obj_what_changed()
  for field in changes:
        updates[field] = self[field]

to get a dict of updates to apply to the database. This patch adds
that as part of the base object and makes every place that does
the above to just use that.

It's a port from a patch in nova ,link to the origional patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/45353/

Change-Id: I8d2616ecc2c88cf4b21e7e8193f5b985407ed869
Closes-Bug: #1259527

commit_message:
Rework patch validation on Ports

This makes use of the complex type objects of WSME and creates a type
to validate json patch format.

Change-Id: I17ea33efec16146d4ece90fd0ef5123faaacefb0
Partial-Bug: #1223847
