why do you not write unit tests?"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-06 12:18:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

But Eugene, there's unittests (test_types.py, https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60194/3/ironic/tests/api/test_types.py)"}, {'account_id': 7308, 'date': '2013-12-06 12:59:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It isn't unit tests. It is functional tests (or system tests). These tests don't test the new code. You should write tests which test only new classes, and not test any other code. If you test StringType class then you test StringType only. All other code must be mocked."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-06 14:09:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Fair about the terminology (I'm a disaster on the test subject), but I still can't picture exactly the benefits, I mean the code is testings individual classes, and for e.g the one you cited the StringType it's does instantiate that class and call it's method directly and about mocking I don't really know what can be/should be mocked there.

Also, the tests looks like the standard way to test things in Ironic, can you point me to any tests in Ironic that match exactly what you've been talking about?"}, {'account_id': 7308, 'date': '2013-12-06 17:49:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ok, let's try to get to the same page. As you probably know unit testing is a method for testing a one unit (that's pretty straight). One unit is the smallest testable part of an application. In object-oriented programming, a unit is often an entire interface, such as a class, but could be an individual method. In our case PatchType class is the unit. In the perfect unit test case this unit should be absolutely isolated from other code units (other parts of code are usually mocked). Of course there could be exceptions, but the main idea should remain the same.
Let's make an experiment. I'm going to replace a part of your code (line 157-160) to "return {}" and run tests. As you will see, all tests will be passed. That's an indicator that unit tests are incorrect and they don't show if your code works well or not.
How do tests help to debug code? If "test_valid_patches" test returns a status code is 400 then what did went wrong? How will we understand the cause?'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-12-08 20:02:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

AFAICT this patch conflates two changes:

 - a port from WSME trunk of a type needed

 - additional of a local type we'll use

Please do one thing per patch; I think that will make it clearer what things we should have local tests for (hint: not the stuff we've backported, as those tests should come verbatim with the change from WSME).

On the testing side - if we can replace the code undertest with a broken version and tests pass, that certainly says we need more coverage. So please do ensure that there are tests that cover:
 - the expected path
 - all domain and range endpoints
 - all paths out of the function

That said, I don't think a simple rule like everything-other-than-the-class-must-be-mocked is sufficient or necessary in evaluating test effectiveness. Mocking is one of a number of test double tools that can be used to provide isolation, but it has plenty of downsides, and is often inferior to other doubles such as tested fakes."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-09 11:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ok I think we can summarize this discussing in: The tests aren't covering what is being returned from the validate() method, I will add to tests to cover it.

@lifeless, agree with you I should do in 2 different patches and in the one that port the class from wsme I should port the tests as well, will do.

Thanks for the review you both, very appreciated :)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-09 11:52:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2013-12-09 12:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-09 12:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Add JsonPatchType class

This patch adds the JsonPatchType class for API parameter validation with
WSME. This class will be used to replace some of the custom validation
functions we have in the api/utils.py.

Change-Id: I233cd273854eae5ed4d8856d4af3e2f8e2309dce
Partial-Bug: #1223847

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,

Change-Id: Ia5c2e65512ab9d1c163171f8617c081ab96745e5
Closes-Bug: #1256049

commit_message:
Fix missing policy enforcement in CFN API

Currently the CreateStack and UpdateStack actions aren't correctly
enforcing the policy, so add calls to _enforce which fixes that,
and rework the test to illustrate the issue.

Change-Id: Ia5c2e65512ab9d1c163171f8617c081ab96745e5
Closes-Bug: #1256049

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 11:34:11.000000000', 'message': 'change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Change-Id: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f
'}]
commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Change-Id: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Change-Id: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

commit_message:
Skip autoscaling test until more reliable

AutoScalingTest has issues which will require rethinking how
this test is implemented, including:
- the optimal ConsumeStopSeconds will depend on the overhead
  of boot time, which varies greatly between bare metal and
  virt-on-virt
- every combination of distro/release/flavor will result in a
  different baseline memory usage, making it difficult to
  determine the ScaleDownThreshold to set

This change skips this test and tracks against the bug:
Partial-Bug: #1257575

Change-Id: I0695a7efacdbeab39c895a97cb45496fcaf97e35

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-07 21:54:05.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround Cinder "wishlist" bug 1255593 for multi-backend volume_clear

Cinder currently only applies the volume_clear setting from the DEFAULT
section of cinder.conf if you're using a single backend.

The Cinder team has determined this is a 'wishlist' item to propagate
volume_clear to each backend, but it does impact usability and
performance.

To improve the performance of running Tempest with multi-backends in the
gate, workaround the bug in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1255593

Change-Id: Ia0ff5422f53eeda9a3ac4336eefec3b9bdea6da2
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround Cinder "wishlist" bug 1255593 for multi-backend volume_clear

Cinder currently only applies the volume_clear setting from the DEFAULT
section of cinder.conf if you're using a single backend.

The Cinder team has determined this is a 'wishlist' item to propagate
volume_clear to each backend, but it does impact usability and
performance.

To improve the performance of running Tempest with multi-backends in the
gate, workaround the bug in devstack.

Related-Bug: #1255593

Change-Id: Ia0ff5422f53eeda9a3ac4336eefec3b9bdea6da2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 14:46:28.000000000', 'message': "Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450
"}]
commit_message:
Add X-Tenant-ID to metadata request

Previously, one could update a port's device_id to be that of
another tenant's instance_id and then be able to retrieve that
instance's metadata. In order to prevent this X-Tenant-ID is now
passed in the metadata request to nova and nova then checks that
X-Tenant-ID also matches the tenant_id for the instance against it's
database to ensure it's not being spoofed.

DocImpact - When upgrading OpenStack nova and neturon, neutron
            should be updated first (and neutron-metadata-agent
            restarted before nova is upgraded) in order to minimize
            downtime. This is because there is also a patch to nova
            which has checks X-Tenant-ID against it's database
            therefore neutron-metadata-agent needs to pass that
            before nova is upgraded for metadata to work.

Change-Id: I2b8fa2f561a7f2914608e68133abf15efa95015a
Closes-Bug: #1235450

commit_message:
move rpc_setup to the last step of __init__

rpc setup should be the last stuff in agent initialization
so that the rcp message handler(the agent instance itself)
can have a fully initialized agent instance.

Change-Id: I58c966e2c8ee92c307b565932e867b5d1ec73b67
Closes-Bug: #1259088

commit_message:
Use /info to check if SLO is enabled

The functional tests have some hokey detection of SLO support that
pre-dates the /info API, but we can do better now.

Also moved the SLO check up inside the setUp method so that skipping
the SLO tests should be somewhat faster now.

Change-Id: I645718b459d794a9a97770f7162934558c94f3e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-31 17:40:47.000000000', 'message': "Debug env for tox

Running a test with pdb was difficult because testr captures
output and causes pdb prompt to quit.

This change adds a debug environment that runs
 python -m testtools.run discover --load-list test_to_run

as described in
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

Now you can do a command like

 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_auth.AuthWithTrust.test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get a prompt.

Change-Id: I2b5dc81f4652dc89ecbcc7c785245a81cf77a1ca

Running a test with pdb was difficult because testr captures
output and causes pdb prompt to quit.

Tips for how to run with debug are provided here:
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

This change puts these commands into a debug env in tox.ini so
you can do a command like

 tox -e debug test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get the debug prompt.

 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

This change puts these commands into a debug env in tox.ini so
you can do a command like

 tox -e debug test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

or, for more granularity:
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension.test_downgrade

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get the debug prompt.

Change-Id: I2b5dc81f4652dc89ecbcc7c785245a81cf77a1ca

commit_message:
Debug env for tox

Running a test with pdb was difficult because testr captures
output and causes pdb prompt to quit.

Tips for how to run with debug are provided here:
 https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

This change puts these commands into a debug env in tox.ini so
you can do a command like

 tox -e debug test_v3_trust_token_get_token_fails

or, for more granularity:
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension
 tox -e debug keystone.tests.test_sql_migrate_extensions.EndpointFilterExtension.test_downgrade

and when it hits your breakpoint you'll get the debug prompt.

Change-Id: I2b5dc81f4652dc89ecbcc7c785245a81cf77a1ca

commit_message:
Replace "tokenauth" by "authtoken" in configuration files

This is the standard word used by all other projects.

Change-Id: Ibd52056bd1214f5fd7b2f2fd315086542d34fd0c
Closes-Bug: 1234314

commit_message:
Added help note in attach volume dialog

Added help note in Horizon's dashboard (Edit attachments dialog), in order to
inform that device name may not match the proposed one.
The intention is to provide more information when device names don't match due
to hypervisor limitations or naming convention.

Change-Id: I39828542047a2f2149815e2beba1099501aa755e
Partial-Bug: #1217874

commit_message:
Ensure api_paste_conf is an absolute path

If api_paste_conf is specified as a relative path and the directory from
where the nova-api service is started contains a file with the same
name, the wsgi loader won't try to find the absolute path to that file
which is required when not passing the base directory to the
paste.deploy library.

This change ensures the config_path is an absolute path so it can be
found by the paste.deploy library.

Closes-Bug: #1259183
Change-Id: I0eb6ef1d69d302634b8c842449f997ec10c13933

commit_message:
Make obj_from_primitive() preserve version information

When we hydrate an object from a remote client, we need to know
the version and not pretend like it's just the current version.

Related-Bug: #1258256
Change-Id: I68bbfa18addfb7e51efc10a757135e338302a787

commit_message:
Install Guide: Add link to proper chapter

Link to networking chapter of the Config Guide, not to the table
of contents.

Change-Id: I65db7709809a5269da248fdebb298df9fd3d838a
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1253514
(cherry picked from commit c1cd94f62b5acc73c41cba17a1af2acdd027fe55)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 07:40:48.000000000', 'message': "Message bus additions for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora distributions

Added the default 'qpid' implementation details for neutron.conf as this was omitted and reported upstream.

Change-Id: I527751f8380dd1883fb9f1159089f7050130fc74
Closes-bug: #1258292
(cherry picked from commit 28975b3c0913be3d35766d5293839e327be748db)
"}]
commit_message:
Message bus additions for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora distributions

Added the default 'qpid' implementation details for neutron.conf as this was omitted and reported upstream.

Change-Id: I527751f8380dd1883fb9f1159089f7050130fc74
Closes-bug: #1258292
(cherry picked from commit 28975b3c0913be3d35766d5293839e327be748db)

commit_message:
Explicitly set keystone auth_strategy

Explicitly set keystone as the auth_strategy. Also moved sysctl
load command closer to where the related config changes
actually appear.

Closes-Bug: #1258295
backport: havana
Change-Id: I8ae977c8eac984c2f56b9318b6369e02847546d1
(cherry picked from commit ec5d0950104f65fdc55e8e8e6821358982bcd293)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 07:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly define "auth_region" in Neutron metadata_agent.ini

The default value for "auth_region" assumes "RegionOne" rather
than "regionOne" which causes the metadata agent to generate
authentication errors.

Change-Id: I0d3395a215eea7b3e3a9760a81e5f72a6bf523a4
Closes-Bug: #1259344
(cherry picked from commit 534aeb30c7a2c38a2f4294eea62c81e501bc9f2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly define "auth_region" in Neutron metadata_agent.ini

The default value for "auth_region" assumes "RegionOne" rather
than "regionOne" which causes the metadata agent to generate
authentication errors.

Change-Id: I0d3395a215eea7b3e3a9760a81e5f72a6bf523a4
Closes-Bug: #1259344
(cherry picked from commit 534aeb30c7a2c38a2f4294eea62c81e501bc9f2a)

added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281

commit_message:
Keystone Verify - Further clarity on the use of ADMIN_PASS

A user reported an issue that the documentation was not clear as to where
the "ADMIN_PASS" paramater came from. I've clarified this further and
added a link to the relevant step to enforce it's origin. Also corrected
a very minor typo.

Note that this is now aware of the way that Debian-based platforms configure
the users in Keystone and links to the relevant page for further assistance.

Change-Id: Ie1722812386591fa0563b57a4127b0042da1ee40
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1252281

commit_message:
Enables E711,E721,E712 pep8 rules

Updates tox.ini to reduce ignored rules.

Updates novaclient/v1_1/shell.py and
novaclient/v3/shell.py for E712 violation.

Change-Id: Ibfd6a4ed19835e65cc9e27873699c31a801e99a8

commit_message:
Speed up FlowDetail.find

Looking up task by its uuid is quite frequent operation, so it worth
having it executed faster. For that, this commit changes how task
details are stored: we now use uuid -> task detail dictionary instead of
list.

Change-Id: Ie098bf982b5fbca799e0f0f1e736eebff06f9671

commit_message:
Fixed PEP8/flake8 issues

We need to fix PEP8/flake8 issues corresponding to the new
hacking rules that got added before we can update to the
new global requirements.

Change-Id: Iff995139d258549ff9a8e3e5018e964efa2ab152

commit_message:
Fix errors for create_endpoint api in version2

1. Create an endpoint without 'service_id' should return a 400 Bad Request
with appropriate message instead of 500 Internal Server Error.
2. Empty urls should be discarded.

Change-Id: I535467ec35fe2ae738ecae0a4f20d19ff4f001ec
Closes-Bug: #1250765

commit_message:
Libvirt: Making the video driver element configurable

hw_video_model can be provided via the image properties in Glance.
It may be set to one of the following values: "vga", "cirrus", "vmvga", "xen" or "qxl",
as these are currently being supported by libvirt.

    glance image-update \
       --property hw_video_model=qxl \
       [image]

DocImpact
Partially implements blueprint libvirt-video-driver-selection
Change-Id: Ie710eb9d8d094865d651373c6f9882f1ac12b49a

commit_message:
Rename instance_type to flavor in baremetal virt driver

Goes through the baremetal virt driver and associated classes and tests
and renames instance_type to flavor. This patch does not handle renaming
instance_type in nova.test.utils or the instance_type_id column in the
instance db model so those parts are left unchanged here.

DocImpact: Renames the 'instance_type_extra_specs' option in the
baremetal group to 'flavor_extra_specs'.

Part of blueprint flavor-instance-type-dedup

Change-Id: I4405464aea2b2e2142ed1207fb9c25ed9e863cb0

commit_message:
LOG.warn() and LOG.error() should support translation

Based on a search done in nova code,
some logs have to be changed in order to support translation

Change-Id: I371b714d004bcd0091ae569d4b82ae8d19fba708
Closes-Bug: #1235088

commit_message:
Remove the api_thread_pool option from libvirt driver

This gave us the option to select if calls to libvirtd are done
in a native thread or directly. This was added because the person
who wrote the thread pool code was afraid of regressions for existing
deployments. But now we have enough features in nova that require
that this is always set to True or else users can have issues with
them. To this point the firewall overrode this option to make
sure that its call was always in a native thread no matter the
value of this option was.

The reasons behind this were discussed during this review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/57000/

Closes-Bug: #1254811

DocImpact: removes api_thread_pool flag from the libvirt group

Change-Id: Ifad7f1bdf2af69e4fcd6f9a04bf2f7ff5251afd6

commit_message:
Periodic task _heal_instance_info_cache can now use slave db

This periodic task will now use a slave db for all reads if a slave
is configured. For deployments with no slave, behavior remains unchanged.

Change-Id: Iafda7ff7a895b21a75c6d3923269f45bc84c81b0
Partially-implements: blueprint periodic-tasks-to-db-slave

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 18:46:41.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: add a test to guard against set_host_enabled raising an error

Commit cc70e3a adds a finally block to _get_new_connection to
automatically disable the host if making a connection to libvirt fails.

The set_host_enabled method currently swallows all exceptions which is
good so it doesn't mask the original libvirt failure in
_get_new_connection, but we need to have a test that makes sure that
isn't unintentionally regressed. This patch adds the test.

Related-Bug: #1257644

Change-Id: I4beec053794edc75ef2d0060a05285f7ed0b99ac
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: add a test to guard against set_host_enabled raising an error

Commit cc70e3a adds a finally block to _get_new_connection to
automatically disable the host if making a connection to libvirt fails.

The set_host_enabled method currently swallows all exceptions which is
good so it doesn't mask the original libvirt failure in
_get_new_connection, but we need to have a test that makes sure that
isn't unintentionally regressed. This patch adds the test.

Related-Bug: #1257644

Change-Id: I4beec053794edc75ef2d0060a05285f7ed0b99ac

[{'created': '2013-10-11 07:46:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add V2 and V3 api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the API does not support.
this patch extend the servers/os-hypervisor to show PCI infomation for
instance and compute node, and also provides a resource:endpoint to show PCI
infomation.

bp: pci-api-support
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Pci_passthrough#PCI_passthrough_use_notes

Change-Id: I99eeeca67983c49433ab0079f490a454d250f5e0
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Shuangtai Tian <shuangtai.tian@intel.com>

commit_message:
Extends V3 servers api for pci support

All pci passthrough code is merged into nova, but the API does not support.
this patch extends the servers to show PCI information for instance and compute
node. This is a part of PCI APIs, for more information see the  blueprint.

Partially implement blueprint pci-api-support

Change-Id: I99eeeca67983c49433ab0079f490a454d250f5e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 19:47:00.000000000', 'message': "Add a trivial functionaltests/run_tests.sh

I need a simple entry point to running the functional test suite for the
devstack gate job.  This script provides that.  Right now it's quite
trivial and just runs nose.  We'll probably want to update this to testr
later, but it really doesn't matter much right now since there's only a
single test case.

Change-Id: I6cd2ce8d11addf70195e2df2e11161cfd58f04bd
"}]
commit_message:
Add a trivial functionaltests/run_tests.sh

I need a simple entry point to running the functional test suite for the
devstack gate job.  This script provides that.  Right now it's quite
trivial and just runs nose.  We'll probably want to update this to testr
later, but it really doesn't matter much right now since there's only a
single test case.

Change-Id: I6cd2ce8d11addf70195e2df2e11161cfd58f04bd

* remove integration_bridge parameter

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 03:51:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the scope to share a server between tests

In test_server_actions.py, one server is created in setUpClass() and
the server would be shared between all tests.
If the server status is not 'ACTIVE' before each test, rebuild_server()
deletes it and rebuilds a server again.

The server_id scope which is passed to rebuild_server() is class variable
not instance variable. In addition, the server_id scope which is stored
with the return value of rebuild_server() is instance variable like the
following:

  [[instance]]                         [[class]]
  self.server_id = self.rebuild_server(self.server_id)

If we need to rebuild a server, the server_id, which is passed to rebuild_
server(), cannot be changed due to its scope. As the result, many server
creations happens in each test. Then it causes "Quota exceeded" exception.

This patch fixes the scope of server_id for sharing the same server between
each tests.

Change-Id: I72b4aa73a6c77cce3a8e777d4f78913fb0986f66
Fixes-Bug: #1257641

commit_message:
Fix the scope to share a server between tests

In test_server_actions.py, one server is created in setUpClass()
and the server would be shared between all tests.
If the server status is not 'ACTIVE' before each test, rebuild_
server() deletes it and rebuilds a server again.

The server_id scope which is passed to rebuild_server() is class
variable not instance variable. In addition, the server_id scope
which is stored with the return value of rebuild_server() is
instance variable like the following:

  [[instance]]                         [[class]]
  self.server_id = self.rebuild_server(self.server_id)

If we need to rebuild a server, the server_id, which is passed to
rebuild_server(), cannot be changed due to its scope. As the result,
many server creations happens in each test.
Then it causes "Quota exceeded" exception.

This patch fixes the scope of server_id for sharing the same server
between each tests.

Change-Id: I72b4aa73a6c77cce3a8e777d4f78913fb0986f66
Closes-Bug: #1257641

commit_message:
Changes trove_client.client.HTTPClient to
trove_client.HTTPClient

Reasons:
 - trove shell is not working.
 - troveclient.client is now imported as trove_client
   but while calling the method it has been called
   as trove_client.client

Changes:
- Changes trove_client.client.HTTPClient to
  trove_client.HTTPClient in troveclient/v1/client.py

Change-Id: I12b0a0d9792f69ad04a17c36a8de134f233afc85
Closes-Bug: #1259882

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 17:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'Make wait & stop methods work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c
Closes-Bug: #1196525
'}, {'created': '2013-12-10 16:45:09.000000000', 'message': 'Sync oslo threadgroup.py to fix wait & stop methods

Sync oslo threadgroup.py to 25ff65e955b7ef1091722224f7c71f14fc971354 so
we include the fix for bug #1196525, which resolves a problem where the
wait and stop methods would not actually wait for/stop all threads in
the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c
'}]
commit_message:
Sync oslo threadgroup.py to fix wait & stop methods

Sync oslo threadgroup.py to 25ff65e955b7ef1091722224f7c71f14fc971354 so
we include the fix for bug #1196525, which resolves a problem where the
wait and stop methods would not actually wait for/stop all threads in
the thread group.

Change-Id: Ia49d7096180b2942cf49b1f0dacde3c5e933337c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 17:00:19.000000000', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

commit_message:
Add zypper element

This provides some customizations for zypper based distributions (e.g.
openSUSE and SLES). It is heavily inspired by the yum element and sets up
zypper to cache downloaded package outside of the chroot so that they can be
reused to speed up subsequent builds.

Change-Id: I775c921ee19cf7d1180fb68c1b7857ea6245a77d

commit_message:
Separate deployments from tasks

The patch introduce deployments as independent operations. The command
line interface supports of creation, deletion and recreation of
deployments. The creation of the task requires the id of a deployment.

The patch also separate samples of configuration to two types: a
deployment and a task.

Change-Id: I5121532057909040e6ab6d6b2cbd6d06812975cb
Implements: blueprint independent-deploy

Change-Id: I02fc3d96cacdbae1be9e9283362bb87518d97a7c

commit_message:
Remove start index 0 in range()

Remove the useless arg ("start index" = 0) in files, since its default
value is 0, to make code cleaner.

Fixes bug #1259744

Change-Id: I02fc3d96cacdbae1be9e9283362bb87518d97a7c

commit_message:
Make _extra_keys a property of ModelBase

Currently  _get_extra_keys() used as as function.
Changing it to read only property makes class interface more cleaner
and reliable
We don't have to explicitly call it and it can't be accidently overriden
by assigning of an instance variable

Change-Id: I236408be953f299854fce80aa38e24708c13a60a

commit_message:
middleware.sizelimit: stop importing wsgi

This patches stops the sizelimit module to rely on the deprecated WSGI
module.

Change-Id: Ie804a74f833112f7d6d30f787f426d6f7ad0be2f

Heh, just noticed that we had this mysql error codes discussion before.  Can't hurt to be testing for it now though.

I looked at the requirements change and it seems to me that there might be problems getting that in.  It leaves me unsure what to do with this because while the other projects don't depend on actual db implementations and thus a fake one makes sense, in this project I would normally say wait for the requirement to merge and then go straight to the real thing.

I need to think about it some more, but I wanted to get my thoughts out here."}, {'account_id': 5313, 'date': '2013-11-26 18:57:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Thanks for comment Ben, some things I have thought about on that aspect. Keystone and Ceilometer do support DB2 today, and I know keystone was waiting on this change to start using oslo-icubator common sqlalchemy. This change with mocked up ibm_db_sa dialect test would at least help get Keystone and Ceilometer moving, that is why I broke this into two patches see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/58338/ which depends on requirements project patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/48745/. For the record I do prefer to test with real thing, like we do for mysql but with this broken down we, at least, have the options to decide at the projects level whether to bring in or not. Hope it helps.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-12-04 09:04:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-27 19:43:15.000000000', 'message': 'Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

Fixes bug 1231657

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Change-Id: I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503
'}, {'created': '2013-09-27 20:38:09.000000000', 'message': 'Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

Fixes bug 1231657

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

commit_message:
Enables db2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables db2 as well.

Partial-Bug: #1231657
Change-Id: I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:59:05.000000000', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

[{'created': '2013-10-25 10:25:03.000000000', 'message': 'Increase the size heuristic for images

Ocassionaly cloud-init fails to resize the disk on first boot, this is
occuring because the filesystem has only 10% free. Nudging the disk size
up a bit more should give us a little more headroom so this is less
likely to occur.

Change-Id: Ib23f3a654151338ad91839e49b323b65b4054245
'}, {'created': '2013-12-11 14:42:45.000000000', 'message': "Increase the size heuristic for images

Occasionally cloud-init fails to resize the disk on first boot, this is
occuring because the filesystem has only 10% free. Nudging the disk size
up a bit more should give us a little more headroom so this is less
likely to occur.

I havn't been able to find out what value ensures we wont hit this
problem but I can say for sure this fixes all casses of the problem I
have seen.

Change-Id: Ib23f3a654151338ad91839e49b323b65b4054245
"}]
commit_message:
Increase the size heuristic for images

Occasionally cloud-init fails to resize the disk on first boot, this is
occuring because the filesystem has only 10% free. Nudging the disk size
up a bit more should give us a little more headroom so this is less
likely to occur.

I havn't been able to find out what value ensures we wont hit this
problem but I can say for sure this fixes all casses of the problem I
have seen.

Change-Id: Ib23f3a654151338ad91839e49b323b65b4054245

My questions inline"}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-12-04 10:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-12-04 11:15:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Thanks for the explanation. The fix makes sense to me'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:15:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Do not merge

The patch looks fine, but I'm not convinced of the wisdom of allowing only 1 instance of a given agent type to run on a given host.  Please raise this question on the mailing list so that we can have as much input as possible in deciding whether the proposed solution is acceptable."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think this bug is not about running several agents of the same type on the same host. 
 If I understood correctly, it is addressing the case when agent posts several rpc messages to the queue and neutron server processes them simultaneously. That could happen if server is started in some time after agents has been started.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:35:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Maru,

Good point! I had been thinking about this too. But the thing is, this is how it's working right now: currently, it's not possible to have a multiple agents of the same type running on the same host. Check https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L148 and https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/db/agents_db.py#L131

So if (due to a race condition) we had a few entries with (agent_type, host) values in agents table, create_or_update_agent() would always raise an error when processing the next heartbeat from the agent. Agent entry would become stale, and no networks/etc would be scheduled to be served by this agent.

So giving the fact that this patch doesn't change the existing behavior of 'allowing multiple agents of the same type per host' (which I though was meant to be correct), do we need to raise this question on the mailing list?"}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:39:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

the host is a config variable that's the hostname if not specified, in theory you could have multiple agents running on the same box, and have different 'host' values."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-12-04 15:53:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

My mistake, as per Roman's comment this change is encoding behavior that is already partially enforced in code."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-12-04 17:16:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-04 17:53:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Fix a race condition in agents status update code

Code handling agents status updates coming via RPC checks,
if a corresponding entry for the given (agent_type, host)
pair already exists in DB and updates it. And if it doesn't
exist, a new entry is created.

Without a unique constraint this can cause a race condition
resulting in adding of two agent entries having the same value
of (agent_type, host) pair.

Note, that it's already not allowed to have multiple agents of
the same type having the same host value, but currently it's
enforced only at code level, not at DB schema level, which
effectively makes race conditions possible.

Closes-Bug: #1254246

Change-Id: I1ebaa111154b3d6b34074705b579097ab730594c

commit_message:
New external.DeprecatedGrizzly auth plugin

Introduce a new plugin (external.DeprecatedGrizzly) to mimic the behaviour
of the external authentication in Grizzly.

Partial-Bug: #1211233
DocImpact: Added a new plugin to mimic the Grizzly external auth

Change-Id: I3f4e6c012591722b0fbca258b867a3e138be428e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 09:12:00.000000000', 'message': "Add a warning to @memoized when caching is impossible

The @memoized decorator cannot cache function calls that take unhashable
arguments. So far it just ignored them, and silently called the function
directly without any cache. This commit adds a warning in such case, so
that we can see where @memoized is not really doing anything.

I used Python's warning mechanism, because we can easily configure the
particular warning to become an exception or to be ignored entirely.

Change-Id: I4b581f504972ffac589fdb78bfb9fb194d2b4525
"}]
commit_message:
Add a warning to @memoized when caching is impossible

The @memoized decorator cannot cache function calls that take unhashable
arguments. So far it just ignored them, and silently called the function
directly without any cache. This commit adds a warning in such case, so
that we can see where @memoized is not really doing anything.

I used Python's warning mechanism, because we can easily configure the
particular warning to become an exception or to be ignored entirely.

Change-Id: I4b581f504972ffac589fdb78bfb9fb194d2b4525

commit_message:
Hide injected_file related quotas for V3 API

The injected_files, injected_file_content_bytes and
injected_file_path_bytes are all related to the
os-personalities extension which has been removed. They
can't be removed from the core quotas code as that has
to still support the V2 API. So for the V3 API we just
hide them.

DocImpact

Partially implements blueprint v3-api-remove-extensions

Change-Id: Iedb6e1427ac22f1926e929f3391e56403c37d088

commit_message:
Fix docstring on novaclient

Something like this:

1. Modify "`Image` to add metadata to" to ""`Image` to delete metadata" on
delete_meta()
2. Modify "The security group to delete" to "The security group to update"
on update()
3. Remove the "password" from the description on update()

Change-Id: I0120d84cc263d4eb58b692a5eb6f20ca0ef8264d
Closes-Bug: #1258461

commit_message:
Adds a --show option to the image-create subcommand

Prints info about the new image when --show is used with the
image-create subcommand.

Change-Id: Id1fba67df9ff86cb1bbda3e241d1d03e01afbe2c
Closes-Bug: 1248128

[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: Ife76a83be95fed7cc4b99bb50a97277d0751e76c
'}]
commit_message:
Add -U to pip install command in tox.ini

Ask pip to upgrade packages in the virtualenv so that a long-lived
virtualenv is still kept up to date as external dependencies change.

Change-Id: Ife76a83be95fed7cc4b99bb50a97277d0751e76c

(1 inline comment)

Looks great to me!'}, {'account_id': 7336, 'date': '2013-08-29 20:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a bit of concern (which I raised in the meeting) that this is the wrong place to be doing data conversion/dropping. It seems to me that the events should be whole representation of the event, and any stripping be done in dispatch. Adding litong as reviewer...if nothing else then we need to have some discussion on where the right place for this is."}, {'account_id': 7336, 'date': '2013-08-29 20:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

That is: Event should be a full representation of the notification.

Discussion here: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ceilometer/2013/ceilometer.2013-08-28-21.00.log.txt'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2013-08-29 21:31:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Phil: I think in that meeting me & litong were talking about different things, but the meeting ended before I realized that. I think he was talking about raw data processing, like log dispatcher, etc. I was specifically talking about extracting sample data.

We need to be able to convert notifications into events in a controllable manner. Yes, we would like to convert many of the notification fields to traits, but only the ones we are actually going to need to use. However, the notifications are nested data, whereas, events are flat mappings, for performance/query reasons. Note that there is another blueprint out there (event-body) for storing the raw notification data for each event (possibly in a different datastore). Traits are for fast, queryable pieces of information we know we will need. the event-body blueprint will take cares of bulk storage of the raw notification, likely in different datastores. Since we are looking at storing 10's of millions of events, the difference (in data size & performance characteristics) is important"}, {'account_id': 8106, 'date': '2013-08-29 23:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (2 inline comments)

Make sure to enable globalization for new message involved.'}, {'account_id': 7336, 'date': '2013-08-30 15:48:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Thanks for the additional context, Monsyne. I think the functionality is well and good, I just question the positioning in the data flow. Unless I'm missing something, this configuration (i.e. breaking up into traits) would impact the content of all downstream dispatchers. Feel free to educate me if I missed something...."}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2013-08-30 16:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

Noted abt the translations.'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2013-08-30 16:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Add configuration-driven conversion to Events

Add configuration to control what traits get added to Events
from notifications, how those traits are defined, and what
notifications get converted (and eventually stored).

Change-Id: I2befc97b3d3b33851a5bfe709bf086895fd72cce
Implements: blueprint configurable-event-definitions

[{'created': '2013-12-09 04:50:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix display_name of volume for test_volumes_list

In test_volumes_list, three volumes are created for some tests.
These display_name seems wrong like "volume-%s1393726625json".
The interface name should be inserted after "volume-", but it is
appended to the tail.
This patch fixes this volume name.

Change-Id: Iee55d2405e888569455a2325fe6b2843ddf9de9d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix display_name of volume for test_volumes_list

In test_volumes_list, three volumes are created for some tests.
These display_name seems wrong like "volume-%s1393726625json".
The interface name should be inserted after "volume-", but it is
appended to the tail.
This patch fixes this volume name.

Change-Id: Iee55d2405e888569455a2325fe6b2843ddf9de9d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Have tox install via setup.py develop

tox 1.6 was released, which means that we can now take advantage of
the feature we added to it - which is using setup.py develop to
install the code into the virtualenv. The logic was taken from
run_tests.sh - so the performance issues around using tox vs. using
install_venv should now be gone.

Additionally, override the tox pip install command to avoid using the
"--pre" option which is the default in tox.  "--pre" means "Include
pre-release and development versions."  By default, pip will only
install stable versions of software, and that is the behavior we want.

Change-Id: Ida5e440d1bdb9f8e9031277ea53a02d2ef171438
Co-Authored-By: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>

commit_message:
ignore failures to apt-get update calls

systems may have a ton of apt repos on them, many of which aren't
really needed. We'd rather take the updates we can, and not fail
on secondary repositories, especially as secondary repository fails
will stop us dead in our tracks.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-09-17 18:48:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Two issues here. If you look at the setUpClass method you will see that these tests are assuming that each test will leave the server in ACTIVE. If it does not, setUpClass will destroy the server and make another one. So addCleanUp should not be used in these test cases. 

I also don't think you should be changing the existing tests to run as admin. I would suggest a separate test class for the tests that need to be run as admin."}, {'account_id': 7139, 'date': '2013-09-23 10:59:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
add admin server tests

- use regular user to resize vm in test_resize_server_using_overlimit_*
- rebuild server when it's in SHUTOFF and ERROR state
- add parameter 'raise_on_error' in wait_for_server_status

Change-Id: Ibd04a1fdaab74fe59bcf16cc99d4ecf4821f4ae2

subject: Store/restore Server from a dict with credentials

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-09 20:28:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-rally-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/29/60929/1/check/gate-rally-pep8/f637c8f : SUCCESS in 2m 15s

'}, {'account_id': 7369, 'date': '2013-12-10 12:56:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why this is necessary? Add please to commit message'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-10 13:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

From what I understand this change implies certain naming convention that all classes must follow (which is not very good actually). What if I would like to name my class attributes starting with "_"? Why standard serialization (pickle) won't do in our case?'}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-12-10 15:57:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Alexei, EnumMixin is used only for creating constraints, so, I didn't changed the legacy logic, I just added a more clear way to iterate over attributes of a class. Yes, it's broken through inheritance. So, about the serialization. This a simple way to serialization/deserialization of Server objects. I thought about pickling, but it's not what we want at the moment because the ResourceManager should be responsible for that."}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:02:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Sorry if I was not clear enough. My comment was related to "to_dict", "from_dict" methods. I think that it's not reliable to assume that parameter names are not changed and that same class instance can be recreated using it's attributes. Cause of this I think that this methods won't work really good in our case and we may consider using pickle instead of them. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-rally-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/29/60929/2/check/gate-rally-pep8/861db80 : SUCCESS in 1m 57s
- gate-rally-python26 http://logs.openstack.org/29/60929/2/check/gate-rally-python26/8ce81e6 : SUCCESS in 2m 55s
- gate-rally-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/29/60929/2/check/gate-rally-python27/e3a58a9 : SUCCESS in 2m 22s
'}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:13:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Alexei, did you mean that the initial parameters can be changed between of calls to_dict/from_dict? So, the pickling also doesn't guarantee of that."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:31:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

Yes but the pickling can guarantee that object you put it is the same as you get out. In your case you create a new instance of cls and you cannot guarantee that it's going to be the same. 

Back to our topic: I guess this patch would be better if it would not assume some naming convention but instead used dir() to scan object for attributes. Unfortunately such approach doesn't provide a way to reconstruct object from dict cleanly.
Another concern is how safe is to call __init__ for arbitrary class? Let's imagine that __init__ of some class is doing some stuff with sideeffects (logging, writing to db) in such case from_dict may cause complex bugs"}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-12-11 09:29:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Alexei, I dare say that the problem that causes at a deserialization in explicit form in case of custom realization of to_dict/from_dict more preferable than silently unpickled object was used in a changed environment. The first method very simple in debuging because only one type of error could happens: wrong attributes. Unpickling contains alot of pitfalls such as renaming classes or classes of attributes, moving classes etc. The logging on initialization, this is normal, as opposed to what I can not say about operations with DB. I'm against having to do any complicated thing on initialization of ImmutableMixin. Okay, I can move this stuff to separate class, like DictableMixin and mixing them with Server class."}, {'account_id': 7763, 'date': '2013-12-11 09:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

>I'm against having to do any complicated thing on initialization of ImmutableMixin.

I mean that some class that derive from this mixin can have some initialization logic:

class Foo(ImmutableMixin):

    def __init__(self, a, b):

        self._a = a

        self._b = b if b % 2 == 0 else b + 1

        db.execute('INSERT INTO logs VALUES( "Foo instance is created BEWARE!")')

Such class cannot be used with immutable mixin cause it will break his logic. Is there any way to prevent such stuff from happening?'}, {'account_id': 7369, 'date': '2013-12-11 09:37:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

ImmutableMixin stands for immutability, why it should be serializable?

We just need ability to save ssh credentials somehow. This may be method get_credentials on Server, or something more clear and explicit."}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-12-11 13:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-11 13:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 20:25:18.000000000', 'message': "Serializable ImmutableMixin

The patch introduces an ability of serialization for class
ImmutableMixin. The methods to_dict/from_dict was added. Both of them
support simple format of a dict:

    {
        'args': <a tuple of position arguments>,
        'kwargs': <a dict of keyword arguments>
    }

Change-Id: I2f9ca4a1c49477d665ba02ff0736c21a7557e12a
"}, {'created': '2013-12-10 16:01:01.000000000', 'message': "Serializable ImmutableMixin

The patch introduces an ability of serialization for class
ImmutableMixin. The methods to_dict/from_dict was added. Both of them
support simple format of a dict:

    {
        'args': <a tuple of position arguments>,
        'kwargs': <a dict of keyword arguments>
    }

A serializability of an instance of class Immutable Mixin is a necessity
of the resource tracking. LxcProvider requires reconstruction of the

commit_message:
Store/restore Server from a dict with credentials

The patch adds two methods to Server class to get a dict with
credentials from instance of its class and restore an instance from
credentials. LxcProvider requires reconstruction of the Server
objects for destruction of resources.

blueprint db-resource-track

Change-Id: I2f9ca4a1c49477d665ba02ff0736c21a7557e12a

Build succeeded.

- gate-noop http://logs.openstack.org/90/61090/2/check/gate-noop/82e1147 : SUCCESS in 2s
'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-12-11 00:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Quoting: "This header is useful if you need strong consistency."

Swift doesn't offer strong consistency. Never has, never will. At best, X-Newest gives the user a lower chance of seeing out-of-date results, but it does not guarantee freshness. There is always a sequence of updates and failures that can happen to cause the user to get stale results, X-Newest or not.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-12-11 11:48:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-11 11:49:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

subject: Change how scrollShift is calculated.
messages: [{'account_id': 9409, 'date': '2013-12-11 17:00:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 16:58:54.000000000', 'message': "Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

    Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

Change-Id: Icd36a50c96943e534379d77d83a37465a84ce451
"}]
commit_message:
Change how scrollShift is calculated.

    In Firefox $('body').scrollTop returns 0, that's why the modal
    appear outside the visible screen. Added $('hmtl).scrollTop.

    var scrollShift = $('body').scrollTop() || $('html').scrollTop()

    Closes-Bug: 1251361

    Change-Id: Icf691eb140e091615a98f1fbd415428cd418ba9e

Change-Id: Icd36a50c96943e534379d77d83a37465a84ce451

[{'created': '2013-12-10 20:19:01.000000000', 'message': "Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: Ic3920c893630d10780f4e6b42451f6b2c1837a66
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: Ic3920c893630d10780f4e6b42451f6b2c1837a66
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <paul.belanger@polybeacon.com>

commit_message:
Deprecate chance and simple schedulers

With the addition of ChanceWeigher, the policies of both the chance
and simple schedulers can now be implemented using the filter
scheduler. Keeping these schedulers unnecessarily increases the test
matrix and significantly increases the development effort of new
features that require scheduler support.

1. Integrated unit tests will now use the default scheduler.
2. For now, print a warning if either of these schedulers is used.
3. New features that require scheduler functions need not add support
   for simple and chance. Any bugs found should still be fixed.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint deprecate-chance-and-simple-schedulers

Change-Id: If75ad20765fa57fc8951edc8ca4b1436f313cfed

commit_message:
Add some logging for nose_discovery process

Methods of DiscoveryPlugin were modified: logic that controls processing
of testset and test entities against db has been wrapped in try...except
block with purpose to provide logging for possible errors which may
occur during this process.

Change-Id: I7647c292ed9f8cb7018cbed64a82a0110001d3a0

Function setUpPackage() from tests/__init__.py was modified: ostf-server
setup was added as child process via subprocess.Process() construction
so that now both unit and functional tests can be run without any pre

commit_message:
Tests refactoring for ci

Function setUpPackage() from tests/__init__.py was modified: ostf-server
setup was added as child process via subprocess.Process() construction
so that now both unit and functional tests can be run without any pre
setup of fake ostf-server nor nailgunmimic because these actions are
managed now by nose.

Change-Id: Icc6972d1aa413321a89c924cda3b9cc9ae9cb4ee

commit_message:
secrets.get should verify that the request is for a single secret

Added sanity checking to the requested URI path to make sure it is a
properly formed secret UUID value.

Change-Id: Ie6598303e502cd19458e0beef24d7fd032f9f14a
Closes-Bug: #1259654

commit_message:
Add processing for additional tests status 'skipped'

In models for enum attribute of Test entity new value has been added.
addError hook method of StoragePlugin has been modified with purpose to
process new result state of executed tests which now can be 'skipped'.
Unit and functional tests were updated.

Change-Id: I593d67eed12a9a20ba795501a1f8cceedfbb4587
Implements: blueprint additional-tests-statuses

commit_message:
Add smoke and sanity verification for ceilometer

import ceilometerclient, created ceilometer manager,
sanity tests, smoke test

commit_message:
opensuse: Update README.md

Remove the comment about the rpm-distro element. The only tiny bit we copied
from it is 01-install-bin. 01-override-zypp-arch was unneeded and has been
removed from the opensuse element before the initial merge.

Change-Id: I9886bb6e7d723690f2d2ac476d6d3aca5a367607

commit_message:
Simplification orders of Bridge creation for OVS agent

Closes-Bug:  #1259924
* use neutron::agents::utils::bridges{} abstraction for create bridges for ovs-agent
* naming Cs_resource for more convinient use.
* remove unneeded relationship

Change-Id: I35540ebb27121111e00668862947e4ee6ab1ee99

Syncing the log from oslo-incubator change Ic2cf3e52 "Adding domain to
context and log" without dependencies.

Note: I did not sync context.py since it's obsolete and not used in Nova.

Changes in the module log:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change Ie2886da6: Don't log to stdout when log_dir is set
Change I97971f2a: Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

commit_message:
Sync oslo log for "Adding domain to context and log"

Syncing the log from oslo-incubator change Ic2cf3e52 "Adding domain to
context and log" without dependencies.

Note: I did not sync context.py since it's obsolete and not used in Nova.

Changes in the module log:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change Ie2886da6: Don't log to stdout when log_dir is set
Change I97971f2a: Unify different names between Python2/3 with six.moves

Change-Id: Ib11e015666701868410d743dad4218d92376d181
Related-Bug: #1248936

subject: Adding information about domain in the context

commit_message:
Adding information about domain in the context

Adding the variables domain_id, project_domain_id and user_domain_id to
the RequestContext in order to be able to implement domain quotas. If no
domain information is in the header the variables are set to 'default',
since it's the default value for domain in Keystone V2.0 API.

Change-Id: Ice7805041d2df72d603e9d56a5df4cf7f5489992
Closes-bug: #1248936

commit_message:
Added method exec_longrun_command.

Unlike exec_command and exec_command_on_vm, this method allows
to start a process on VM in background and leave it alive
after it closes the SSH session.

Change-Id: If7a831330249035f22ad1abb9a2aa780ab1cf4fe

commit_message:
Non major core refactoring

Some utilities were grouped in new file mixins.py. This was done with
purpose of code spreading minimazing. Because of that two files are not
neede any more so they were deleted (utils/utils.py and wsgi_utils.py).
Unit and functional tests were updated.

Change-Id: Ia0752eaf145ca38b17a4d3f30b9c0e72566a1288

[{'created': '2013-12-09 12:00:55.000000000', 'message': 'Port StringType class from WSME trunk

Port the StringType class and its tests from WSME trunk. The StringType
is needed for the implementation of our PatchType class that will make
use of the complex type validation of WSME to remove some of the custom
validation code.

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60194/

Change-Id: If387ed915e4d0102112f93ed16eee13775b54f4c
'}]
commit_message:
Port StringType class from WSME trunk

Port the StringType class and its tests from WSME trunk. The StringType
is needed for the implementation of our PatchType class that will make
use of the complex type validation of WSME to remove some of the custom
validation code.

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60194/

Change-Id: If387ed915e4d0102112f93ed16eee13775b54f4c

commit_message:
Hide AZ when creating Volume from snapshot

Volume created from snapshot must match the AZ of the snapshot.
It doesn't make sense to allow the user to select the AZ as the
only valid values are Any AZ or AZ of the snapshot - which the user
still need to figure out.

Change-Id: Id3fb03fc2bc152ae0af72b939f63d9d403324fe6
Closes-Bug: #1257845

commit_message:
Add a loadAngular function

    If something is added to the DOM with external tools, angular is not
aware of these changes (Ajax call, pure js DOM manipulation, etc...).
This patch add an utility function which will load angular on the given
element.
    There is also an example on modal, angular is now loaded when a
modal is shown.

Fixes bug #1258192

Change-Id: I3266b455d79d7d1856e4a622e927ed4af8e90b5e

commit_message:
Change nova::api doc to conform to style guide

Parameter doc that does not match the style guide
cannot be used to generate useful RDoc using
puppet-doc, this patch fixes the nova::api class.

Change-Id: I8fcd26825e18450ec6838f456575e1850a597046

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 03:45:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove glusterfs_disk_util option

The glusterfs_disk_util option has been removed. I have manually
removed this entry from the current configuration tables and the
flag mapping.

As it is no longer in the code it will also no longer appear in
future auto-generated versions of the tables.

Closes-Bug: #1259419

Change-Id: I4aa606b3920347caa896c5b65ddcff6d9faf9881
'}]
commit_message:
Remove glusterfs_disk_util option

The glusterfs_disk_util option has been removed. I have manually
removed this entry from the current configuration tables and the
flag mapping.

As it is no longer in the code it will also no longer appear in
future auto-generated versions of the tables.

Closes-Bug: #1259419

Change-Id: I4aa606b3920347caa896c5b65ddcff6d9faf9881

[{'created': '2013-12-11 13:08:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix database configuration in heat.conf for YUM

Follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61402
The Heat installation notes refer to the database configuration as done
in master, but it doesn't work completely with the new format in Havana.
Let's keep the old format for now.

Change-Id: I8f47206b0ae4856c67139c0b3634bb7880c37cc9
Closes-Bug: #1257436
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix database configuration in heat.conf for YUM

Follow-up to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61402
The Heat installation notes refer to the database configuration as done
in master, but it doesn't work completely with the new format in Havana.
Let's keep the old format for now.

Change-Id: I8f47206b0ae4856c67139c0b3634bb7880c37cc9
Closes-Bug: #1257436
Signed-off-by: Emilien Macchi <emilien.macchi@enovance.com>

commit_message:
Tests refactoring for ci

Function setUpPackage() from tests/__init__.py was modified: ostf-server
setup was added as child process via subprocess.Process() construction
so that now both unit and functional tests can be run without any pre
setup of fake ostf-server nor nailgunmimic because these actions are
managed now by nose.

Change-Id: I74a99053273af7c8257cc8775d05d05e3387e9b2

commit_message:
Add some logging for nose_discovery process

Methods of DiscoveryPlugin were modified: logic that controls processing
of testset and test entities against db has been wrapped in try...except
block with purpose to provide logging for possible errors which may
occur during this process.

Change-Id: Idac9883e8bff5034fcd4970fed98e831b538147b

from the commit message and the information returned in H104 its unclear what you are trying to do."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-01 21:45:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

If we are saying we don't want Licence headers in empty files (which makes sense to me), we need to make sure the hacking doc (http://docs.openstack.org//hacking/) says that.  For general guidlines for adding a new check see http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-dev/hacking/tree/README.rst#n35

I am all for enforcing no  licence in an empty file.  But if a file only has a license and some comment and no code, I don't think we want to enforce no licence header for that."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-01 21:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

almost forgot, thanks for contributing'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-12-02 09:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-02 09:56:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- gate-hacking-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/90/59090/7/check/gate-hacking-pep8/d754895 : SUCCESS in 32s

- gate-hacking-integration-nova http://logs.openstack.org/90/59090/7/check/gate-hacking-integration-nova/ad8a3d8 : SUCCESS in 3m 38s (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-02 16:29:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The only case in nova that I found that contains anything besides a license header in a 'blank' file was: nova/network/security_group/__init__.py

neutron has many similar cases, where its a copyright header and an author tag:

./neutron/services/loadbalancer/drivers/__init__.py

So on a high level I like this rule, but this isn't what was discussed on the ML


 > I'm totally in favor of going further and saying "empty files shouldn't
 > have license headers, because their content of emptiness isn't
 > copyrightable" [1]. 


With that in mind I think this version of the rule, needs a round on the ML to make sure no one objections to dropping the author tags in init files.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-02 16:31:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

I really do like this rule, I just don't want any surprises about it later."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-12-02 16:53:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Just to verify - this won't flag something like https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/report/__init__.py right?  I don't think so, but I'm not terribly experienced with hacking so I'm not sure how it handles docstring blocks."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-12-02 17:00:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Ben, thanks for pointing out that example. I just tested it and that file doesn't trigger this rule.

For reference here is the output of this patch when run against oslo-incubator http://paste.openstack.org/show/54300

generated with 'tox -eintegration openstack oslo-incubator'"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-12-02 17:19:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Okay, thanks Joe.  If I'd been thinking I would have tried that myself.  I blame the long weekend. :-)

Sounds like we just need a consensus on the author comments then."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-12-02 17:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-12-02 17:37:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Added more tests so it's clearer what it does, and sent a mail to the ML just in case."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-02 17:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Works for me

commit_message:
Add a check for file with only comments

That should catch things like __init__.py files with only license
headers inside.

Change-Id: I6a2078f6264ef252d4eb431c8df33db0913ba3bf

subject: don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks
messages:
[{'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-11 12:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-11 12:58:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2013-12-11 13:23:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'd rather see the approach suggested in bug 1253774, but am okay with considering this as a stop-gap if that's where it's hurting us most at the moment. I guess I'd want to know, first, whether there are good reasons to be performing an apt-get update/upgrade at all in any of those jobs, and would prefer we solve this correctly (whatever correctly means in this case) and consistently once there's time to discuss further."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-11 13:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

taking a different approach with I08b19cd4d48fba3b4884fa4bc011cde451136594 instead'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 12:26:26.000000000', 'message': "don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211
"}, {'created': '2013-12-11 12:58:33.000000000', 'message': "don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211
"}]
commit_message:
don't have grenade hit the network with apt, as the network breaks

... a lot

grenade is currently triggering an apt-get update before it installs
packages, which isn't appropriate in the node pool nodes. It also
ends up breaking a ton when rax nodes decide to not be able to get
access to apt.puppetlabs.com.

This will short circuit that logic.

Closes-Bug: #1259911

Change-Id: I357be8ab500aa734d399e71e49739fc113e93211

Closes-Bug: #1257436

commit_message:
Fix database configuration in heat.conf

The Heat installation notes refer to the database configuration as done
in master, but it doesn't work completely with the new format in Havana.
Let's keep the old format for now.

Change-Id: I8ad8f4a9dfbe107fda93bf35f289c304a6ec1949
Closes-Bug: #1257436

commit_message:
JavaScript use policy

Add a point to HACKING.rst pointing to the Horizon docs about
contributing.

Add information about JavaScript support policy to the contributing
docs.

The policy is based on:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-November/020342.html

Change-Id: I16a51c7ab7faf68d6e7984c113da175c5c08650d

commit_message:
Initial setup of python project layout

It's a result of partially applied cookiecutter template for OpenStack
projects. We need it to be able to commit new patches.

Change-Id: Ib980b8924921da3b7e2740ecac05ce8d34c43951

commit_message:
Updated Savanna part of the docs for Fuel 4.0

 * Changed all links to docs and artifacts from Savanna 0.2.2 to Savanna 0.3
 * Also added a sentence to make smooth transition between Additional Checks
   and Platform Tests sections
 * Added .gitreview

Change-Id: I98f8d7a148af54429f4b9fb080a6ae1cd5fad251

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-11 11:27:01.000000000', 'message': 'change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Backported From: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

Change-Id: I453ea0f16d5cf6274511676f789e7667b0a8984c
'}]
commit_message:
change sphinx requirement to < 1.1.99 because 1.2b3 exists

< 1.2 seems right, except 1.2b3 is also < 1.2 by python version
rules. In the gate, with the mirror, this seems to work. However
on local envirnments 1.2b3 is often pulled, and local doc builds
break.

Backported From: I719536a0754bb532b800c52082aeb4e2033e174f

Change-Id: I453ea0f16d5cf6274511676f789e7667b0a8984c

commit_message:
Set auth_uri for keystoneclient authtoken

Updates are authtoken middleware settings so we configure auth_uri.
This resolves several log WARNINGs that appear when the config
isn't set.

Ideally keystoneclient would set auth_uri automatically.
A known issue...  see keystone bug #1207517

Change-Id: I0b8ce0a52d1c094c18aae85f76acf5fc33b814b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-11-15 09:10:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove asserts for optional imports

Horizon's __init__.py has some code that explicitly allows it to
be imported by setup.py before Django is set up, by making import
failures just throw a warning instead of an exception. But that code
is defeated by a bunch of asserts that were added later, that just
make the error even more confusing.

I'm removing the asserts and replacing them with __all__.

Closes-bug: #1210253
Change-Id: I0fde7810a033fd7216da9a5460f5e4e323b4d6e9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove asserts for optional imports

Horizon's __init__.py has some code that explicitly allows it to
be imported by setup.py before Django is set up, by making import
failures just throw a warning instead of an exception. But that code
is defeated by a bunch of asserts that were added later, that just
make the error even more confusing.

I'm removing the asserts and replacing them with __all__.

Closes-bug: #1210253
Change-Id: I0fde7810a033fd7216da9a5460f5e4e323b4d6e9

[{'created': '2013-12-11 09:38:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add .gitreview
add ordering

Fix bug with auto_assignment for Savanna + Neutron

[nailgun] New node naming convention in ssh.config

The slave nodes are called node-NN now istead of slave-NN.

	Flush IPs on all interfaces that are members of a bond

	- This is needed to prevent the situation when Puppet
	is trying to assign an IP to bond, which is already in
	use on some of bonded interfaces.
