commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

Change-Id: Iea62bf9f5a1a6b729ab2ddb6d0c6390a7dc9dca1

Ia there a reason you changed the skips code to use is_extension_enabled rather than the decorator you added for that?'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-11-27 21:38:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Because the decorator is for a test method while the skips here were done at the setUpClass level. It's the same reason a decorator wasn't used before this change. I don't think the decorator would raise the skipException in the right place on a setUpClass. (although I should probably experiment with that to confirm)"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-11-28 03:25:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 6983, 'date': '2013-11-28 03:47:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-03 15:57:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Chris I'm going to bring this up during the QA meeting this week. I went with this approach based on a previous meeting. I like your way, it makes sense to me but I want to have a consensus on the UI around this first. (FYI my original idea was a bool config option for each extension)

@YangLei I'm not exactly sure what your -1 is referring to. Can you please clarify what you mean."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-03 21:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The meeting discussion about this starts at 17:18:14 in http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/qa/2013/qa.2013-10-24-17.00.log.html'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-03 21:29:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Chris, actually after rereading the log from the previous meeting we specifically decided against what you recommended here. Sean raised a real issue with using excludes and when a new extension is added. I had forgotten most of the details, so I'm going to leave the UI here as is in order to make it more explicit at the cost of an annoying UI for some. (and drop it from the agenda for Thurs. meeting)

We really need to change the meeting times so you can attend :)"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2013-12-06 13:37:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

think I spotted a minor issue?"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2013-12-06 15:13:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Add config options for enabled extensions

This commit adds a new set of config options to the feature_enabled
groups for a list of enabled extensions. These options are used to
specify whether all extensions are enabled or which subset is expected
to be enabled. This just sets up the initial framework for doing
this and converts the FlavorExtraSpecs tests to use it.

paritally implements bp config-cleanup

Change-Id: I6a5a9b16e62eb8a216334a0662c99f0dd0d16873

commit_message:
Add a REST API to disable/enable a flavor.

If a flavor is disabled, it is invisible to tenants while show a list of flavors.
But if a flavor is already associated with instances, a tenants can still access it by the flavor_id.

usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor> <disabled>

Sample request:
REQ: curl -i 770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12">http://127.0.0.1:8774/v2/770bbdfdd5c2472383641bb33b77725a/flavors/12
                 -d '{"flavor": {"OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled": true}}

Sample output from CLI:

cloud@devstack:~$ nova help flavor-disabled
usage: nova flavor-disabled <flavor_id> <disabled>

Change the visibility of a flavor between Enabled and Disabled.

Positional arguments:
  <flavor_id>  flavor id.
  <disabled>   value of disabled (true or false).

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-disabled 12 true
+--------------------------+-------+
| Property                 | Value |
+--------------------------+-------+
| OS-FLV-DISABLED:disabled | True  |
| disk                     | 0     |
| extra_specs              | {}    |
| id                       | 12    |
| name                     | test  |
| ram                      | 1024  |
| vcpus                    | 1     |
+--------------------------+-------+

cloud@devstack:~$ nova flavor-list
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| ID | Name      | Memory_MB | Disk | Ephemeral | Swap | VCPUs | RXTX_Factor | Is_Public | Disabled |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+
| 1  | m1.tiny   | 512       | 1    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 12 | test      | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | True     |
| 13 | test1     | 1024      | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 2  | m1.small  | 2048      | 20   | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 3  | m1.medium | 4096      | 40   | 0         |      | 2     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 4  | m1.large  | 8192      | 80   | 0         |      | 4     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 42 | m1.nano   | 64        | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 5  | m1.xlarge | 16384     | 160  | 0         |      | 8     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
| 84 | m1.micro  | 128       | 0    | 0         |      | 1     | 1.0         | True      | False    |
+----+-----------+-----------+------+-----------+------+-------+-------------+-----------+----------+

Change-Id: Idf03d9e8e2086b24b06047309f2f1d72bb26d41d
Closes-Bug: #1259262

commit_message:

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

Change-Id: I3ecf8535bd8f8ea0ee17aabc7ad418ff31f16366

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 15:59:23.000000000', 'message': "Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana
"}, {'created': '2013-12-10 21:26:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana
"}]
commit_message:
Remove outdated libvirt_vif_driver settings

There is no longer a need to modify the libvirt_vif_driver conf
setting, it should always be the default value of:

libvirt_vif_driver=nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver

This patch removes any reference to deprecated options for the
libvirt_vif_driver parameter.

Closes-bug #1192833

As a side-effect, this patch removes a section that contains this note:

      <note>
        <para>When using libvirt < 0.9.11, one must also edit
            <filename>/etc/libvirt/qemu.conf</filename>, uncomment the
          entry for 'cgroup_device_acl', add the value '/dev/net/tun'
          to the list of items for the configuration entry, and then
          restart libvirtd.</para>
      </note>

It's not clear to me whether this is required or not with the
generic VIF driver plugin.

Change-Id: I233b18c8021bae6218faee63828c093d9b5b883d
backport: havana

commit_message:
Explicitly set keystone auth_strategy

Explicitly set keystone as the auth_strategy. Also moved sysctl
load command closer to where the related config changes
actually appear.

Closes-Bug: #1258295
backport: havana
Change-Id: I8ae977c8eac984c2f56b9318b6369e02847546d1

commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

From openstack/requirements 0e8862e:
1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

Closes-Bug: #1259511
Change-Id: Icab356add6cd1e6515c55027538dd770c95d3457

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

We also had to adjust the pip command used.

Change-Id: I8894c0199db845e90e5086a7c0e6bb7c7a26b5a0

commit_message:
Ignore fewer PEP8/flake8 rules

Reasons:
- code should be pythonicaly clean,
  that is why number of ignored rules should reduced

Changes:
- E125, F811, H102, H103, F201, H23,
  H302, F841, H301, H702, H703 rules are now enabled

Change-Id: Ibf4025162244d3c2f1278b49a76ec1527a729042

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 20:59:13.000000000', 'message': 'Oslo sync: make wait/stop funs work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Additionally, vim headers was removed.

Change-Id: I254992b06c24cbf31f02e8f2b29430df57c85da6
'}]
commit_message:
Oslo sync: make wait/stop funs work on all threads

Previously, ThreadGroup.wait and ThreadGroup.stop would iterate over
the self.threads list and call the wait or stop method on each one.
This list could potentially be edited concurrently by the _thread_done
callbacks and remove some items in the list.  As a result, the wait
method would not actually wait for all threads in the thread group.

Additionally, vim headers was removed.

Change-Id: I254992b06c24cbf31f02e8f2b29430df57c85da6

commit_message:
Sync global requirements to pin sphinx to sphinx>=1.1.2,<1.2

Sync the global requirements to pin sphinx.  This addresses an issue
where Sphinx 1.2 is not building documents correctly and causing
check/gate to fail.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 20:24:30.000000000', 'message': "Sync requirements: pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See:

http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I45c59b30b0afd6be8ce94390042f5e75534046bd
"}]
commit_message:
Sync requirements: pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See:

http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I45c59b30b0afd6be8ce94390042f5e75534046bd

five seconds between the expected and actual time.

Closes Bug: 1259298

Change-Id: I51a65f71d2e9cdf5ae0eb10b2f5b207b2d74a80b
'}, {'created': '2013-12-09 23:39:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use fuzy compare for datetimes in usage tests.

Before this, the tests would often fail due to a single second of drift
from the expected usage time and the actual time in which the event was
recorded in the database. This code allows there to be a small delta of

Change-Id: I51a65f71d2e9cdf5ae0eb10b2f5b207b2d74a80b

commit_message:
Use fuzy compare for datetimes in usage tests.

Before this, the tests would often fail due to a single second of drift
from the expected usage time and the actual time in which the event was
recorded in the database. This code allows there to be a small delta of
five seconds between the expected and actual time.

Closes-Bug: 1259298

Change-Id: I51a65f71d2e9cdf5ae0eb10b2f5b207b2d74a80b

commit_message:
Fix wrong configuration for `service_plugins`

Change `service_plugins =
neutron.plugins.services.agent_loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin`
to
`service_plugins =
neutron.services.loadbalancer.plugin.LoadBalancerPlugin`

Fixes bug #1257210

Change-Id: Ida84acc3ba3d167a3a39c38f55b0c9de781f1b56

commit_message:
Message bus additions for RHEL/CentOS/Fedora distributions

Added the default 'qpid' implementation details for neutron.conf as this was omitted and reported upstream.

Change-Id: I527751f8380dd1883fb9f1159089f7050130fc74
Closes-bug: #1258292

'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-12-10 11:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Changing old migrations is bad, any subtle differences between the old and the new versions are likely to cause us a headache with no gain.'}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-12-10 12:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Duncan, this patch will improve the performance of DB migration as there is no need to set the values to None for a new column.'}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2013-12-10 13:57:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Migration performance is less important than migration correctness. By all means do this on future migrations, but changing old migrations for anything other than critical bugs is not something I think we want to be doing - even 'obviously correct' changes have been shown historically to introduce issues."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-12-10 16:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I'd have to agree with Duncan on this.  I don't see any value in mucking with migrations for something that is of little benefit and even though it may be doing something unnecessary it's not actually incorrect, or resulting in any sort of an issue.

I'd prefer not to mess with existing migrations for this."}, {'account_id': 7494, 'date': '2013-12-10 21:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Thanks John and Duncan, just abandon this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 01:10:05.000000000', 'message': 'Do not set column values to None explicitly when migrate DB

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_8/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.Column

According to above link, when create a column, if did not set the
default value of the column explicitly, then the API will set it
as None by default, so when migrate DB, there is no need to set
new added column values to None.

Change-Id: I595459f13e341e538c2c51d41385e1deb0880ecc
'}]
commit_message:
Do not set column values to None explicitly when migrate DB

http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_0_8/core/metadata.html#sqlalchemy.schema.Column

According to above link, when create a column, if did not set the
default value of the column explicitly, then the API will set it
as None by default, so when migrate DB, there is no need to set
new added column values to None.

Change-Id: I595459f13e341e538c2c51d41385e1deb0880ecc

Small clean in nova/compute/manage.py

  The variable image is not used.

Change-Id: I39f64a5bb5add59a7d112117b21fe9941fc1a5b3

Now that we have cut Havana it is time to move on and use
it (instead of Grizzly) for forward facing Icehouse testing.

This is holding up Nova migration compaction at the moment.

Change-Id: Ib64dafbd3aeb968fb71752a5a26fad105045f5f8
'}]
commit_message:
Bump grenade master to use stable/havana.

Now that we have cut Havana it is time to move on and use
it (instead of Grizzly) for forward facing Icehouse testing.

This is holding up Nova migration compaction at the moment.

Change-Id: Ib64dafbd3aeb968fb71752a5a26fad105045f5f8

[{'created': '2013-12-10 18:45:42.000000000', 'message': 'Handle skips because of config in skip_because

This commit adds support to the skip_because decorator to internally
handle config options for skipping. This enables removing all the
calls to TempestConfig() in skip decorators to use that as conditions
for skipping.

Change-Id: Idc610f1910fd46187081a2bef76eb0d383e96611
'}]
commit_message:
Handle skips because of config in skip_because

This commit adds support to the skip_because decorator to internally
handle config options for skipping. This enables removing all the
calls to TempestConfig() in skip decorators to use that as conditions
for skipping.

Change-Id: Idc610f1910fd46187081a2bef76eb0d383e96611

The code change looks reasonable but it is not clear to me just looking at the code change exactly what this actually does and why it is being changed.  Can you please refer to a bug # or provide more context in your commit message."}, {'account_id': 8090, 'date': '2013-12-09 21:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 8411, 'date': '2013-12-09 21:15:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Where is service type defined? Savanna-dashboard should refer on some doc. The only place I see is a devstack commit https://review.openstack.org/#/c/60077/2.

Another related question: is "data_processing" a good name? Other projects either use '-' (like 'object-store') or nothing (like 'cloudformation'). As I see we are the first project with underscore.'}, {'account_id': 7555, 'date': '2013-12-10 13:12:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

~alazarev - I agree that "-" is probably a better choice. I went looking for other examples of multiple word names and could only find object-store, which while it uses (my preferred) "-" is only one data point. If I found two I would have rejected the use of "_". In the absence of data the devstack CR you reference is the only precedent we have.

As for where the service type is defined - we should include some documentation at some point with our recommendation for type. The service type name is ultimately in the hands of the deployer. The last time I can find (google) that we discussed this in documentation is https://savanna.readthedocs.org/en/stable-0.1/quickstart.html

IMHO, it's a bad thing for everyone who deploys savanna to have to make a decision about what to call the service-type.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-12-10 14:11:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The data_processing is now the reference catalog type for savanna due to the usage in devstack, so, this change should be updated with better commit message and merged. I'll start the discussion in the ML to resolve any potential concerns on it and if we'll decide to change it than separated CRs will be created for all repos where we need to change it."}, {'account_id': 7132, 'date': '2013-12-10 14:14:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-10 14:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Update default service name

Savanna client is now using 'data_processing' as a default service
name for Savanna in Keystone catalog.

Change-Id: Ibf0afbf1c08eb184b5282e6dd6346d66afe4cfdb

commit_message:
Replace inheritance hierarchy with composition

In the process of unification of the clients code we should use
composition to allow easier replacement with common HTTPClient.

Related to blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I1e4ec379e1f6289ed26a5a3157917d3d20a36bd6

subject: Sync oslo lockutils for "fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe"

commit_message:
Sync oslo lockutils for "fix lockutils.lock() to make it thread-safe"

Pull in oslo-incubator change Ia18e6e9f "fix lockutils.lock() to make it
thread-safe" along with dependencies.

Note: I've intentionally excluded log.py from the sync since it pulls in
Change Ic2cf3e52: Adding domain to context and log which is (1) unrelated
to the lockutils change and (2) also changes context.py, which lockutils
does not depend on.

Changes by module (from oldest to newest)
=========================================

excutils:

Change Ic36fa050: Enable H302 hacking check
Change Ibf3c56e4: BaseException.message is deprecated since Python 2.6
Change I87fd89ff: excutils: use six.reraise to re-raise
Change If640e551: excutils: replace unicode by six.u
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

fileutils:

Change Ia51d416b: Add utils for creating tempfile
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

gettextutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

importutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

jsonutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header
Change I90be8797: Use six.iteritems to make dict work on Python2/3

local:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

lockutils:

Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

timeutils:

Change I397bae40: Add helper method total_seconds in timeutils.py
Change Ic6f0c0ef: Remove vim header

Related-Bug: #1065529

commit_message:
token provider cleanup

UUID and PKI tokens are peers, and PKI should not be a subclass of
UUID.  This is the start of a cleanup effort to break the Provider
into a pipeline, but done in a way that each change is understandable
on its own.

Change-Id: I0720695b91d20a675374e713fe9ac6c0d7120484

[{'created': '2013-12-06 07:46:49.000000000', 'message': "Quota violations should not cause a stacktrace in the logs

Don't show exception logs in api log for resize operations
if the resize operations lead to quota violations

Change-Id: Ia101c599908c7652cc07fa4c7e7f1b057943e031
Closes-Bug: #1235389
"}]
commit_message:
Quota violations should not cause a stacktrace in the logs

Don't show exception logs in api log for resize operations
if the resize operations lead to quota violations

Change-Id: Ia101c599908c7652cc07fa4c7e7f1b057943e031
Closes-Bug: #1235389

commit_message:
Save PKI token in a file for PXE deploy ramdisk

Vendor passthru API should be used for PXE deploy from ramdisk,
but we must have a valid PKI token for authorization. PKI token
saved in a file in the tftp root for further read from the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I8e5f1cf0a0c48874b694f24226613a8db4d49cd1

commit_message:
Use update_task_metadata in set_task_progress

Instead of duplicating logic done for updating
or creating a task details metadata property we
can just use the new update_task_metadata as
the single function that can do this.

Change-Id: I66041a157b3f37ca083f8e743ec348ca8feacac6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 00:24:44.000000000', 'message': 'Capture task duration

Record how long a task took to execute (or fail) and

commit_message:
Capture task duration

Record how long a task took to execute (or fail)
by adding a new listener (and associated refactoring)
that can be used to record these time statistics in
storage.

blueprint capture-task-duration

Change-Id: I9c556e5dcbad924380ae4b94ffb03bc22edad50a

commit_message:
Make the following attributes are configurable in chef attribute.

auto_assign_floating_ip
disk_allocation_ratio
allow_resize_to_same_host
force_dhcp_release


Change-Id: I434fc5f77cdb800f17eb9e240263b2643717e7a0

commit_message:
setting the utf8 charset manually for mysql no longer required

this is now done by the db_uri library method in
openstack-common/libraries/endpoints.rb

Change-Id: I93c5ac383fb870eb1604cf68b200a564100663a3

commit_message:
Sync oslo rpc

Sync openstack/common/rpc to fbbb12ea5ff51df744d3de1f312bbcf75aea1670
so we get the fixes required for bug 1257293

Change-Id: Ib2f13d1af91e005c5ee74d462c3fb307f699e7ca
Closes-Bug: #1257293

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
"}, {'created': '2013-12-10 16:34:11.000000000', 'message': "Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb
"}]
commit_message:
Pin Sphinx to <1.2

1.2 was just released and has a bug that causes builds to fail with
the error:

  error: 'source_dir' must be a directory name (got `...doc/source`)

See: http://bugs.python.org/issue19570
and: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/sphinx/pull-request/193/builddoc-shouldnt-fail-on-unicode-paths/diff

Change-Id: I0487b4eca8f2755b882689289e3cdf429729b1fb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 16:36:29.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent filename truncating when downloading objects with Firefox

Filenames containing blanks get truncated when downloading using
Firefox. Put double quotes around the filename, to ensure it does
not get truncated.

Change-Id: I303c05f4bbf9bf00536442d47a9401c087562dc2
Closes-Bug: #1259610
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent filename truncating when downloading objects with Firefox

Filenames containing blanks get truncated when downloading using
Firefox. Put double quotes around the filename, to ensure it does
not get truncated.

Change-Id: I303c05f4bbf9bf00536442d47a9401c087562dc2
Closes-Bug: #1259610

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-09 23:34:10.000000000', 'message': "Make pbr only a build-time dependency.

This lets you build python-marconiclient packages that don't require pbr
to be installed at all. You would need pbr on the machine running
rpmbuild / debuild, but not on the machines that install the packages.

Unfortunately, this does not make python-marconiclient able to be
installed via pip 0.3.1 on Lucid; you'll need to uninstall the system
python-pip package and install a new pip some other way. Given that pip
< 1.3 doesn't perform SSL certificate validation for pypi (trivial MITM
attack, anyone?), you'd probably want to get a new pip anyway.

Change-Id: I2fb160b6dd446f1fc72eed2371db1afcb00b9e52
"}]
commit_message:
Make pbr only a build-time dependency.

This lets you build python-marconiclient packages that don't require pbr
to be installed at all. You would need pbr on the machine running
rpmbuild / debuild, but not on the machines that install the packages.

Unfortunately, this does not make python-marconiclient able to be
installed via pip 0.3.1 on Lucid; you'll need to uninstall the system
python-pip package and install a new pip some other way. Given that pip
< 1.3 doesn't perform SSL certificate validation for pypi (trivial MITM
attack, anyone?), you'd probably want to get a new pip anyway.

Change-Id: I2fb160b6dd446f1fc72eed2371db1afcb00b9e52

commit_message:
Hide key field in edit Flavor Extra Specs dialog

Nova allow user to add key/value to flavor, but its api is only
able to update value according to key.

Hide the key field in edit dialog, in order to avoid confusion.
User can delete and create new one when need to update "key".

Change-Id: Ibd13bfe8a3832d019d16a39b40f643b860e3c612
Closes-Bug: #1257882

commit_message:
Use code from AdvNetworking for MS SQL Cluster IP validation.

Use code borrowed from murano-conductor for generation of subnets
against which both MS SQL Cluster IPs should be validated (they should
belong to that subnet). Old validation of static IPs is no longer
sufficient because CIDR's are generated by murano-conductor during
deployment.

Valid subnet, once generated in dashboard for validation purposes, is
stored in murano-api environment for later use by murano-conductor
(DRY). Subnet is generated for every new environment, but is used only
during MS SQL Cluster IP validation.

This commit comes in a team with 3 following commits:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59982/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59983/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/61072/

Change-Id: I24b3c057fe43e9a35a96ddf2c4defd4f64e9b4ea

baremetal: volume driver refactoring and tests

Refactor the LibVirtVolumeDriver to test each step of
attaching and detaching a volume. And add tests.

Closes-Bug: 1240470
Change-Id: I51906bec6ba5d6af71997df277bb368cff81b3b3

commit_message:
XenAPI:  Increase DomU's memory

Devstack has been increasing in complexity, and if we use too
much of our memory it can lead to fragmentation which in turn
causes a DomU error and a failure of random tests.

Change-Id: Ide9cc84625caed4e35a64a47ee1e92a6cd567651

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1192, 'name': 'David Kranz', 'email': 'dkranz@redhat.com', 'username': 'david-kranz'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-06 20:47:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-12-07 14:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

nice catch'}, {'account_id': 7139, 'date': '2013-12-07 17:07:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Cool Bob! I have ever had trouble with this problem too.
I want to give a -1 about the implement. It would be better to add waiting server code into cls.create_image_from_server for all codes invoke that function could fix the problem."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-12-07 22:20:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm happy to change there - however this was a deliberate choice.

If we change the base method it will slow down all tests (even if only a little bit) - whereas on a test by test basis you can optimise where the waits go.

Do you still feel this should be pushed upwards?"}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-12-08 15:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I've had a look at the other uses of the base method - I'm not sure what the behaviour in the base method could be as the wait_until option is used to return when the image is "saving".  I could change the base method to have another server_wait_until kwarg but I don't see why future callers of this method would know they may need to add the kwarg.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-08 18:49:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is a really bad landmine that I certainly would have tripped over. I suggest adding the extra kwarg but making it default to True, and changing existing methods to pass False if appropriate. That way the unaware test writer will err by making the test slightly slower rather than by introducing a subtle race condition."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-12-08 18:51:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

I'll withdraw my -1 because the change is technically ok, but it would be a good public service to fix it so we don't deal with this again."}, {'account_id': 7139, 'date': '2013-12-09 01:33:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: No score

@Bob, thanks for you reply! Except test_list_image_filters.py, the create_image_from_server only used in test_images.py, and its test cases probably don't have such race conditions. So, I agree with David's opinion. And withdraw my -1."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-12-09 11:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After some more thought I've come up with a different approach which I hope will be more suitable.  If we use the wait_until='ACTIVE' on the create_image_from_server then we can default to waiting for the server to become ACTIVE too.

Therefore if someone uses the wait_until syntax they get the expected behaviour - but if you want to mess with what you wait for, then beware of the dragons.

New patch coming."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-12-09 11:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-12-09 12:02:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 19:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Race condition in ListImageFilters tests

The server may not have moved back to ACTIVE state for
a short period after the image has been successfully
uploaded - so wait for the server to be ACTIVE
before continuing with the tests

Change-Id: I2d471c83d902a408004a4b2ccb8b42fdfcd764b0
Closes-bug: 1258635

commit_message:
Race condition in ListImageFilters tests

The server may not have moved back to ACTIVE state for
a short period after the image has been successfully
uploaded - so wait for the server to be ACTIVE
before continuing with the tests

Change-Id: I2d471c83d902a408004a4b2ccb8b42fdfcd764b0
Closes-bug: 1258635

commit_message:
Specify tenant_id when retrieving LBaaS/VPNaaS resource

In Neutron API, resources from all tenants are listed when
retrieving a list of resources with admin role. Horizon
project dashboard is for project-specific operations,
so we should retrieve only resources of the given project.
LBaaS/VPNaaS panels have this problem, but FWaaS does not.
router_list should be called with tenant_id filter too.

This commit also fixes VPN/FWaaS tests so that it extract tenant_id
from request attribute rather than use tenant_id of test_data.

Change-Id: I080e6c6d1e426a878c1d088763bbc7e5add15820
Closes-Bug: #1244126

Please change summary line to:

  avoid exception with resize-confirm on NFS (KVM)

Is this just ignoring the warning though?
I.E. the -f option to rm will ignore warnings.
If that is what you wanted, you could avoid the
separate process overhead with:

  shutil.rmtree(..., ignore_errors=True)

But perhaps you might want to handle/log the error here,
which can be done with rmtree() also."}, {'account_id': 8651, 'date': '2013-11-05 14:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, p-draigbrady
   I agree with you that I should describe it more clear, I will change the summary line.
   About the code change, I do not need to handle error log like other part which use "utils.execute('rm', '-rf', target)" in driver.py. We just need remove the directory which is not useful now if we confirm to clean up. When use NFS, remove the directory using shutil.retree() maybe create .nfsXXX file, generate OSError and make the directory can not been deleted. Using ignore_errors=true, I am not sure that we remove the directory at last and not just ignore the error log. I will test it. Thank you!'}, {'account_id': 8651, 'date': '2013-11-05 14:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi, Matt,
   I found there are some unit case about _resize_cleanup in 
Nova, they all use stubs to skip file operation process, and 
in oslo-incubator project, I see some unit test about module 
processutil which utils.execute() used,
https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/tests/unit/test_processutils.py
So I think we do not need to add unit test for my code change, 
maybe we can add some unit test to oslo-incubator separately 
if we need, Thanks :)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-11-18 19:12:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"There are no tests for this now" is not a justification for why we don't need tests. They're a reason why it's broken in the tree right now. Please add tests to make sure this doesn't become broken in the future.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2013-11-18 19:21:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Libvirt:Instance resize confirm issue against NFS

when I test resize-confirm on NFS (KVM) using at least two
compute nodes, OSError will occur when try to cleanup the
backup instance directory and will make instance status
"Error".

One way to cleanup resize is using delay_on_retry and
maximum attempts setting. Replace rmtree() because
execute() have more parameters choices.

Closes-Bug: #1248019

Change-Id: Ifb9a500bbba805af0317307c2e7d6903dcd02ad1

commit_message:
Raise better exception if duplicate security groups

Previously a 500 error was raised if one was trying to launch an instance
with a security group that shared the same name as another security group.
With this patch a more clear error message is raised.

Closes-bug: #1161472

Change-Id: I285bedbb2e0b3f4cd24cfa3a9b17131ad0200afa

commit_message:
Tempest should be configured with upgrade projects only

This avoid problems try to test projects that are enabled by devstack in the
gate but are not upgraded with grenade.

Change-Id: I7490e88352cdb2afcd3806cc4f62991ae2b43c5c

commit_message:
Modify upgrade-* scripts to allow skip configuration if not needed

This allow grenade to move and test from a brand new release to master without
any change.

This way it allows to enable d-g grenade testing new-release->master where for
a just released Openstack means that we don't need any new configuration yet.

Change-Id: I3e685deb61b95116420eae9cacb6b38dc405ffe9

commit_message:
Sync openstack.common.test.py from Oslo

In keystone/openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py, line 30
imports `test` which doesn't exist in Keystone yet. Oslo project contains
appropriate file.

Closes-Bug: #1255532
Change-Id: I529022f378623cf2b1285535752fd286bd348a8e

Remove the use of uuidutils in db models

Modified the model definitions and added a new migration script.

commit_message:
Add cciss p serperator in fuel main ks

Add support for the cciss p seperator so that said devices can be used to
install fuel

Closes-bug #1259276

Change-Id: I9acdd755e35dd077f7b1f94ea7436258cbc39b92

Also, I had a patch that bumps the api works from 0 -> 4 and haven't seen the tempests tests pass with it enabled. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59787/ I'm not -2 on this though if there is a good reason we should backport it."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-12-09 21:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

IMO I don't think we should backport this. Also, I had a patch that bumps the api works from 0 -> 4 and haven't seen the tempests tests pass with it enabled. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59787/ I'm not -2 on this though if there is a good reason we should backport it."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-12-10 04:22:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Aaron - This backport does not enable multiple api workers - it only makes it possible to enable them.  Being able to offload wsgi handling to separate processes increases scalability of the neutron service, but as you have seen, there are still upper limits related to rpc overload (since rpc is still limited to a single process at present).  

Bottom line: While this isn't a complete solution, it is a necessary part of it - we need this.  The fact that the patch does not affect default behavior and is minimally invasive should make this a no-brainer."}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-12-10 04:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-04 21:36:17.000000000', 'message': 'Creates multiple worker processes for API server

This change to the WSGI code uses openstack.common.service to create
multiple worker processes to handle API load.  The main process will
start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.  The main process becomes the parent
and manages the children.  The parent is not a worker.

Backwards compatibility is preserved by setting api_workers to 0, the
default.  In this case, no separate worker processes are spawned and
the worker threads run in the main process.

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

Change-Id: Iffa76041d0055840ccca852814b0e71f17a950ac
'}]
commit_message:
Creates multiple worker processes for API server

This change to the WSGI code uses openstack.common.service to create
multiple worker processes to handle API load.  The main process will
start up a configurable (workers=??) number of child processes which
will all listen on the bind port.  The main process becomes the parent
and manages the children.  The parent is not a worker.

Backwards compatibility is preserved by setting api_workers to 0, the
default.  In this case, no separate worker processes are spawned and
the worker threads run in the main process.

Implement blueprint multi-workers-for-api-server

Change-Id: Iffa76041d0055840ccca852814b0e71f17a950ac

commit_message:
suppressing traceback from paramiko in case of node unavailability

It's neccessary becase it looks to scare in logs and may initiate wrong
diagnostic.

Change-Id: Ie59505f442909c11c1ae1f16329674c433e32a9a

This looks like a really cool idea! I'm trying to test it out right now, but I'm not sure I can figure it out. I have tuskar + horizon installed, but removing the _50_tuskar.py config file doesn't remove the infrastructure tab. Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-15 06:51:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Those settings are loaded *before* your settings_local.py, so whatever you have in your settings_local.py takes precedence. I'm guessing that since you have Tuskar installed, you have added it there..."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-11-15 08:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Thank you for the proposal.

I'd love to see this, but it just fixes the issue partially.

The case, that you add something somewhere below e.g project is currently not covered. Esp. for the router tab, I'd expect people wanting to add own "plugins" to manage their own proprietary hardware. The same situation will be true for other dashboards as well.'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-15 08:27:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Those files can add as much configuration, as needed, and there is no limit of one file per dashboard, so when you need to add something of your own, you just create a new file with the right configuration.

I'm not sure how to access the project configuration programmatically, but any additional configuration that we wan t to support can be added to this system."}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2013-11-15 09:03:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

The sorting by file name is not a good idea IMO. What's the problem with having a property ORDER=XX into the dashboard module? Also we can adopt a policy - i.e. orders 1-10 are reserved for System dashboards, while 11-> to be available for user dashboards. Later we can apply custom ordering based on user preferences (cookie, user profile, etc.). 

Also I do not see an option to reload the dashboards at runtime? Does it need to restart the web server in order to add new plugin? It is not much different than modifying the settings file as it is now.."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-15 09:55:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> The sorting by file name is not a good idea IMO. What's the problem with having a property ORDER=XX into the dashboard module?

That's what I actually had in my initial sketch, but this approach is what system administrators and packagers are familiar with. Is there any particular advantage of using a property that you have in mind?

> Also we can adopt a policy - i.e. orders 1-10 are reserved for System dashboards, while 11-> to be available for user dashboards. Later we can apply custom ordering based on user preferences (cookie, user profile, etc.).

There is a reason why they are 10, 20, 30 and not 1, 2, 3 -- so that you can easily insert your own stuff between them. Custom ordering based on user preferences makes no sense, because the order has to be known at the configuration loading time, since they have to be executed in order (they may be redefining or adding to the same variables, so order is important). User preferences for display-related stuff (like the order of tabs) is a completely separate thing, and out of scope of this blueprint.

> Also I do not see an option to reload the dashboards at runtime? Does it need to restart the web server in order to add new plugin? It is not much different than modifying the settings file as it is now...

Yes, in order to see changes that you make in Django configuration you have to restart the Django process (not necessarily the whole server). That's how Django applications work and it's not going to change soon. The important advantage of this approach is that every plugin can now come with its own separate configuration file, so installing a plugin doesn't involve modifying existing configuration files, which was the problem for the packaging guys."}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-15 10:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-18 10:59:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@mrunge I did some experiments, and it turns out that the plugins can just import and extend the existing PanelGroup and Dashboard definitions at import time. It works as expected as long as it happens before the panel autodiscovery, which happens when the URLs are computed, so after the panels are loaded. We might want to add some helper function for showing how this should be done (and for the ability to change this mechanism later on without changing the plugins code), but I think it's doable."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-26 06:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-11-26 06:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-26 10:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-11-26 10:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

+1 here to prevent another abandoning. I think this is something we (me!!) really want(s) to include'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2013-11-26 11:02:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks. Just remember that we don't really want *this* particular patch merged, as it contains some example non-default configuration.

I wonder what would be the best course of action from here."}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2013-11-26 11:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Plugin-based dashboard configuration

This is a proof of concept of how plugin-based configuration of
OpenStack dashboards could be realized. Additional plugins add
their configuration file in the opestack_dashboard/enabled/
directory (the exact location is up for discussion, we will
probably want a whole hierarchy of locations, with the possibility
of overriding settings).

An example file _50_tuskar.py is added to show how an additional
dashboard could plug into this system. If you have tuskar_ui installed,
this would add Tuskar to Horizon.

Change-Id: Iaa594deffbdb865116f6f62855c32c8633d2b208
Implements: blueprint plugin-architecture

commit_message:
Fix violations of H302:import only modules

Comment '# noqa' was missed in some files, led to pep8 warning.
And some modules imported non-module. This patch fixes them.
This is output of violation:
http://logs.openstack.org/77/60977/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/4a00515/

Change-Id: Id79bca9820853ecd9f0660a855d7bb2fe42ec806

to the image file, and we already have an architecture field

commit_message:
Add architecture field in image properties.

It would be beneficial for us to be able to add architecture
to the image file, and we already have an architecture field
on update Image dialog.

Change-Id: Ic48a377b5a449ac632a72f9fb5cbdfafaf39993f
Closes-Bug: #1257191

Eh, can someone explain me, please, what was wrong with patchset 2 approach? Are the functions used somewhere else besides diff_list_of_dict()?

If not, why can't we change functions' parameter format? Personally, I liked json solution more."}, {'account_id': 8641, 'date': '2013-12-05 21:42:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

@Jakub and @Jianing, if the caller of str2dict is comfortable for the format change of input parameter, I'm +1 as well.

And please add some comment for the function of str2dict, to prevent the possible confusion of how to use it correctly."}, {'account_id': 7676, 'date': '2013-12-06 00:14:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Jakub I bring the following reason:

We both have str2dict and dict2str in neutron and neutronclient. In neutronclient, we use current string representation passing dict argument on CLI. Although these functions of neutron and neutronclient are virtually irrelevant, changing the string representation brings inconsistency between neutron and neutronclient, which might be confuse in the future.  

So I think it means we have to keep the current string representation and solve the ',' and '=' escape problem in some other way."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-12-06 00:21:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Increase Horizon base unit test suite.

Add unittests for templatetags, decorators, filters and common utils.
Complement tests merged on commit #258e9b465314d33e669b77b52cec63b2c8aca370

Change-Id: I3f4486815a11c22d6bbcaa014b8e632b43d3be89

"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-12-03 19:33:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Are you trying to work around a specific issue or is this just a general optimization to reduce the latency of the account HEAD operation at the expense of some accuracy?  Not that any one account DB is more or less likely to be more or less "correct" than the cache, but then background replication and container updates could fix that; and they aren't going to be wiping the cache...'}, {'account_id': 6198, 'date': '2013-12-03 19:55:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

It would seem to be a good thing to use the cache consistently across all requests so that the proxy server responses are in line with each other.'}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-12-04 13:56:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@ClayG, @Peter: Yes this is an attempt to optimize HEAD request on the account by reading metadata from cache to build the response more quickly. This acts more or less the same for container and object HEAD requests. About the accuracy problem you've mentioned ClayG and the fact replicator and updator will not update account db I assume we have the same problem for container and object server when HEAD are performed and served by the cache.

I need to check functional tests some of them seems to fail then."}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-12-05 10:36:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-12-05 10:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

- check-grenade-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/84/59784/5/check/check-grenade-dsvm/7b03f5d : FAILURE in 30m 41s
"}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-12-10 12:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thank to the functional tests I have figure out that using the cached metadatas for building a response to a HEAD request on an account will lead to an un-accurate response. Container-count and Bytes-used meta will be completely un-accurate as the update of those meta are done by a direct PUT request to the account server. In the account server there is no easy way to invalidate the account cache entry on the proxy memcache.
@ClayG Sorry I haven't completely understood your response. No 
it sounds clear to me."}, {'account_id': 6889, 'date': '2013-12-10 12:03:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Abandoned

Thank to the functional tests I have figure out that using the cached metadatas for building a response to a HEAD request on an account will lead to an un-accurate response. Container-count and Bytes-used meta will be completely un-accurate as the update of those meta are done by a direct PUT request to the account server. In the account server there is no easy way to invalidate the account cache entry on the proxy memcache. @ClayG Sorry I haven't completely understood your response. No it sounds clear to me."}]

commit_message:
AccountController now uses cache for HEAD requests (WIP)

Account header informations are pushed to caches
once account storage server has been requested.
This patch allow the proxy server to use
that cached headers for HEAD request on accounts.

Change-Id: I618866ba4a8cd189a643153c1fb8e5a1deb37616
Implements: Blueprint swift-account-head-caching

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-06 10:38:22.000000000', 'message': 'Removal of json2.js

    As long as Horizon does not support any browser lower than IE8,
json2.js library is no longer needed, browsers have a native
implementation of JSON.stringify and JSON.parse.
    Removing this script allow us to reduce the javascript footprint
of Horizon.
    jQuery $.parseJSON will replace all parsing of JSON in order to
standardize the use of this functionnality.

Change-Id: Ifaf027e2adc462ee7b3d9587b28583ade376ccfc
'}]
commit_message:
Removal of json2.js

    As long as Horizon does not support any browser lower than IE8,
json2.js library is no longer needed, browsers have a native
implementation of JSON.stringify and JSON.parse.
    Removing this script allow us to reduce the javascript footprint
of Horizon.
    jQuery $.parseJSON will replace all parsing of JSON in order to
standardize the use of this functionnality.

Change-Id: Ifaf027e2adc462ee7b3d9587b28583ade376ccfc

six lib dependency  in savanna client brokes OSTF installation

commit_message:
Implementing Mistral Rest API Client

Added support for:
* Workbooks
* Executions
* Tasks
* Listeners

Partially implements blueprint: mistral-poc
Implements blueprint: mistral-pythonclient

Change-Id: Id515697171e1e94e3354d92343e6bdd5365e45c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-12-10 08:42:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix URLs of panels grouped into packages

If you group related panels into packages using the
dot notation, the URLs generated for them will have
the dot in them where you would rather expect a
slash. This patch fixes it by replacing the dots in
the panel slug with slashes when generating URLs for
them.

Change-Id: I450321f2c2a64297fbd3e1104ad5635aa5d9aba8
Closes-bug: #1259458
'}]
commit_message:
Fix URLs of panels grouped into packages

If you group related panels into packages using the
dot notation, the URLs generated for them will have
the dot in them where you would rather expect a
slash. This patch fixes it by replacing the dots in
the panel slug with slashes when generating URLs for
them.

Change-Id: I450321f2c2a64297fbd3e1104ad5635aa5d9aba8
Closes-bug: #1259458

commit_message:
Set can_set_mount_point default to False

Patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/59229/ only changed the default
value in the local_settings.py example file. If the setting isn't defined,
it still defaults to True

Change-Id: Ia3525786e5eb9ec83b8057c1cb6158ab153adc59
Closes-Bug: #1255136

commit_message:
Revert "Use code from AdvNetworking for MS SQL Cluster IP validation."

Reason: the commit was prematurely approved.
This reverts commit 7492333859774bea1b842e66c26ccfc6e4813f68.

Change-Id: Iea5aed34b3555631e768433891548698436ccdf7

commit_message:
Nova Aggregate wrapper to manage host allocation pools

Proxy interface for managing AZs or Pclouds in the
next future

Implements bp:host-reservation-pool

Change-Id: Ife4949896c1679c941df5b7059a8fbcbf55ec287

The enforcement of the copy_from policy is missing during update allowing

commit_message:
Enforce copy_from policy during image-update

The enforcement of the copy_from policy is missing during update allowing
every user to do this action no matter what is defined in the policy.json

Change-Id: Iecf11bdf220b37d9ecbb6fc686214d14acf1d3dd
Closes-bug: #1259241
